Reviews.Title: “Beware when booking from Expedia, Priceline, Hotwire, etc!”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: I did read the reviews before booking this property, however, I figured that I would "get luckier" than others have. Bottom Line: If you booked thru an outside reseller's web site, you WILL be sent to the courtyard. If you balk about it, they will offer you a tower room as an "upgrade" for $20/nite. And, you WILL be charged the $16/day "resort fee". As many a reviewer stated, the courtyard rooms are full of irritants -- short shower head (I am 6' 2") and it points straight down, noisy loading dock all night long, and, it's true that housekeeping works through the night, so you WILL hear a lot of rukus from the hall - ALL NIGHT LONG. BRING EARPLUGS FOR COURTYARD ROOMS. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “okay stay”
Reviews.Author: mewmama
Reviews.Content: Once one got thru the maze of the courtyard & into a room, the room was basic & adequate. I found it neat & tidy & housekeeping was fine. "What a deal " , I thought, until I checked out & got hit with the resort fee. This raised the cost up quite a bit in an unpleasant manner. I did not find a need to use any "resort " items ... -- I have my own phone & did not use theres. -- in Vegas to R&R.. no need for gym-- and too cold to use the pool ! --Had a rental car-- did not use shuttle Never again - >> I will be staying down town in April for the same price ... along with some nice perks (free slots/ 2 free meals ) for the same price *and* no resort fees .

Reviews.Title: “I think this hotel is good value!”
Reviews.Author: Francofile37
Reviews.Content: We just stayed in a tower room at this hotel and quite frankly I did not expect much as I usually don't stay at 3 star hotels, however we were pleasantly surprised. We had a tower room which was clean, modern, nicely decorated. The bathroom was large and nice. We were quite pleased. The Hallways were bright and clean.. I found the hotel in general, although slightly old-fashioned, very clean and well maintained. The pool area, was nothing special, but just fine for us. All and all I would say we would stay there again. They also have a shuttle to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO!”
Reviews.Author: Annie1234567890
Reviews.Content: I have been used to staying at motels during travel, so I've pretty much seen everything. This is one of the worst places I've been to. When I was booking this, I had not realized that this was a courtyard room. I was told when I arrived and they asked for an extra $30 per room for an upgrade. I rejected the offer because I was thinking this was a casino, so it shouldn't be TOO bad... But I was wrong. The courtyard room was basically structured like a motel. It's a separate two-story building outside the casino and happened to be right next to the back of the casino. This is the area with all the garbage cans and delivery trucks, so imagine trying to get some sleep. In addition, right outside is where the employees take their breaks from work, so you can hear people talking/laughing and see them smoking right outside your window. The shower was so small, there was barely enough room to stand. Room looked dirty like it has never been vacuumed. And another thing they charge and extra $16/day resort fee for this piece of crap room. Also, it takes about 15 minutes to get to the strip including time on the freeway. DO NOT GO!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and smelly”
Reviews.Author: jetsettinjen
Reviews.Content: I did my homework before booking this hotel and that's why I was extra disappointed in our stay. We booked a renovated room but got stuck in an older main floor room next to the highway. That I could have lived with but this older hotel has poor ventilation and you can smell the smoke everywhere. I think someone had smoked in our room before and they used a powerful cleaner/air freshener to try an eliminate the odour. This chemical made me sick to my stomach - literally. Not a great way to start a fun weekend in Vegas. Breakfast was included in our stay but we didn't eat there once. The buffet line up was long, the food looked terrible, and again that area reeked of smoke. We ended up walking around the outside of the building in order to avoid the overwhelming smell of this hotel. The most ironic part is that shortly after we got home, we got an email asking us to complete a survey. I shared the concerns I posted here and was prompted for permission to have someone from the hotel contact me. So far, no one has. My recommendation: stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than a motel 6 just over priced”
Reviews.Author: mrskerns
Reviews.Content: I stood here for a night and rate was 177.00 for a standard room. Im glad it was only for one night because there wasn't anything special about the room. Which in fact the bed skirt was filled with weird stains and carpet was dirty the wood in the bathroom looked dirty as if no one ever wipes the wood with pledge or even at all because it was sticky just like the bed skirt from the bed. The chairs looked stained and dirty as if some liquid fell and no one bothered to wipe or clean them down

Reviews.Title: “Run far away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: Sara K
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Palace Station after a long flight from NYC only to find out that the tower room we paid for was not available and they were giving us a courtyard room. The courtyard rooms should be demolished because they're that nasty and run down. I called the front desk daily because we were told that our room would be available the next day but that never happened. So we spent 6 nights in that dump because Travelocity would not help us get a refund. The Palace Station only offered two free breakfast buffets for our trouble... funny thing is that in no way makes up for the extra $15 a night we paid to stay in the tower rooms. Between the rude staff and mangagement of the Palace Station and the lack of customer service Travelocity provides our trip was ruined. Also - if you're traveling with family GO elsewhere because there was numerous hookers inside the property and homeless people will approach you in the parking lot because the security does nothing but sit at the doors. You have NO protection in the parking lot or garage.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Place To Stay,Gamble, Or Eat In Las Vegas!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: john o
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place to stay in vegas! If you want to rest after having fun? This place is not for you. My wife booked the rooms for her sisters wedding on priceline.com. Priceline.com screwed up on our reservations. Then after dealing with rude employees at the front desk, we were all given rooms in the Courtyard. The rooms were NASTY! No tub, just stand up shower, No bedspread, just sheets with thin blanket in between, No water pressure, Water would go from hot to cold back and forth through entire shower,The heater was loud and either too hot or too cold, People running up and down halls being extremly loud and rude, Security doing nothing about it! and even the security that walked by talking loudly as they occasionally cruised the hall, The maids where VERY RUDE and LOUD as they talked and walkie talkies echoed the halls! And if you want to WIN MONEY? This is not the casino for you. These are some of the tightest machines I have ever played! You might as well just burn your money you will get the same results! The food there is also NASTY! Especially the buffet! If I go to vegas again I will NEVER stay at the palace station or any of the station casinos again period! A motel 6 would put this place to shame!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: Courtside rooms are dated and need many updates. Hotel reeked of stale smoke throughout. Bed were worn out, carpet stained and needed to be replaced. About 1 1/2 miles off of north end of strip. Shuttle to airport does not start running until 6:00 am. My flight left at 7:00 am so it cost me $35.00 by taxi. Good advice is to rent a vehicle but beware of the other drivers. Alcohol flows freely and most of them drive home after drinking all night. Check shows that are on before going and would be wise to book them before leaving. Had booked Celine Dion ticket but she cancelled after holiday was booked. Only other shows in town were 7 Cirque du Solei shows and lots of unknowns.

Reviews.Title: “5 night 6 day stay”
Reviews.Author: justatexasgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked in advance through a company on line. I read enough reviews to not book a courtyard room. We did walk through the courtyard hallways to go and look at the pool area. Just seeing the hallways made me so thankful I didn't book one of those rooms. My husband and I stayed in the Luxury Tower on the 10th floor, non-smoking, king-size bed and nice marble countertops in the bathroom. It had another sink and large mirror before you go into the bathroom which is nice for bathroom privacy if someone else needs the sink. We had a nice view of the mountains to the right and the strip to the left. The parking garage was our view below and across from us. There was a large tv which was nice but would've been nicer if you could get more channels. The bed was wonderful, so comfortable as well as the pillows. Our room was cleaned very well. I do believe they need to update the tubs, the outside of ours was stained and the bottom still had the residue from stickers that were once on it. Endless hot water, something I have trouble finding in many hotels, but found it here. Great places to eat with great prices. My only grip is the only way to the buffet restaurant was through all of the smoke in the casino. I do agree the shuttle does not run often enough and they need to inform all of the staff that give out information, over the phone, where exactly the shuttle picks you up, not at the Forever 21, where taxi and other shuttles show up, but BEHIND it in the parking garage. Also on the way to the hotel from the airport, we asked how much it cost for a cab to the strip and were told it was $40. They make you feel like they are saving you so much, (that you end up giving them a tip), the shuttle being "free", which it isn't because it's included in the "resort fee" of $16 + tax per day, no resort that I could see. It was $12 for a cab. I don't understand why they don't go up on the price of the rooms, to cover the "resort fee" instead of sneaking it in on people at the last minute and tell people, "oh, that fee includes your internet, your phone calls, the gym, shuttle and the use of the pool". In Texas, that's not a resort fee, that's what you pay for when you pay to stay at the hotel! Plus in most cases, you at least get free coffee and usually a free breakfast. Nothing is free here, I'm surprised you don't pay to ride the elevator. (oh wait, guess that's included in the "resort fee" LOL) The pool area doesn't even deserve a review. I guess it does meet the requirements for the definition of the word "resort", just not what we envision when we hear the word. Resort: A place that is a popular destination for vacations or recreation, or which is frequented for a particular purpose. Over all, we had a good stay, a clean, comfortable room and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Avoiding the dreaded resort fee in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WhiteAnt2008
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as I found an excellent rate that justified staying in an “off-strip” hotel. It is very easy to access the hotel from the I-15 – something you’ll appreciate after a long drive to Vegas, and from the hotel it’s a short drive to the more seedy end of the strip – but easy to either drive up the strip, or use the I-15 to get closer to the parts of the strip you want to visit. Part of my deal was that I didn’t have to pay the dreaded “resort fee” – it’s about time more people had a “we’re not gonna take it” attitude with this onerous money-grabbing enterprise. I did still need to reinforce the fact that I shouldn’t be charged it at check-in – but fortunately I had brought proof with me. The excellent rate included the breakfast buffet – although it seemed so poorly organised, and such a trek to find it, I wondered if it was worth it – perhaps those staying longer get used to all its foibles. The room lacked the sort of amenities you expect in even a basic room – e.g. coffee making facilities, but this is typical of Las Vegas hotels as they look to increase revenue. My big concern was security – as well as seeing a distraught woman in the casino who had had her bag stolen, my room was leafleted overnight by an outside bunch of hawkers. I was in the Courtyard section, which lacks an elevator to get to the second floor rooms, but does give you a better feeling you might find the exit quicker in event of an emergency that you would do in the labyrinth of the casino, or from the tower rooms. The Courtyard rooms were better inside than out, with a new shower fitting, and a comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: gregoryA60
Reviews.Content: Our one night in Vegas was at the station and in the courtyard area. The rooms were clean but just very average, it was rumored that rooms in the tower were nicer. The one positive was the steak restaurant which was very good with excellent service. The hotel is not on the strip and although easy to get to, is not that convenient to the glitter that is Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hidden fees.”
Reviews.Author: denvernet
Reviews.Content: I thought I got a good Internet deal on a hotel room at Palace Station. Upon checking in, however, I was informed of a $16 "service charge" which was added onto the cost of my room! The desk clerk informed me that it was for use of the television, pool, etc. and was a mandatory fee. I feel these service should have been included in the cost of the room and that this service charge was just a way to charge more for the room than was advertised. The room itself was not clean, the hallway was noisy and the pool was full of roof shingles that blew off the roof! I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jen W
Reviews.Content: I love the courtyard rooms. Was placed in tower room as an upgrade and hated it! The bathroom was disgusting! I used to live in Vegas and had my mom stay in the courtyard rooms with no issues and every time I go back its where I stay. I love Palace Station

Reviews.Title: “Get ready to smell like smoke!”
Reviews.Author: Neal W
Reviews.Content: If you’d like to get an idea of what urban life would be like if smokers ruled the world, then you should make a visit to Las Vegas. There is smoking in the casinos, at the slot machines, at the table games, and on the streets: smoking, smoking, smoking. The only places I didn’t see smoking was in the restaurants and on the non-smoking floors of the hotels. If you smoke, you will probably love the Palace Station. When you first walk into the hotel, you immediately smell the smoke. Years of in-house smoking have embedded the smell deep into the carpet and walls. It is a smoker’s paradise. People smoke while playing casino games and while just walking around inside the casino or outside. It seems that all casinos allow smoking while people gamble, but there are other casinos that do a better job of keeping the smell of smoke out. On the other hand, if you’re a person who hates the smell of smoke, I would suggest that you plan a vacation to a city other than Las Vegas. As far as the Palace Station itself is concerned, it was a decent 3-star hotel. We got a free upgrade. The room was large and comfortable. The elevators were fast and efficient, although there was one that shook a lot as you went up or down. There is a grand buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. It is cheap and nice, though the most direct route to the buffet is to run the gauntlet of smokers in the casino. The main negative factors of staying at the Palace Station were: (1) Hidden fees. Every guest must pay a $16+ fee per day for hotel services (shuttle bus, internet connection, etc.), whether you use them or not. We didn’t know about this fee until we arrived. With the addition of the fee, I realized that I could have gotten a hotel on the Strip for the same price. (2) Not located on the Strip. If you book a hotel on the strip, you can walk to most shows. However, at the Palace Station, you’d better have a car. The Palace Station has a shuttle bus, but it runs so infrequently as to be practically worthless. (3) “Business Center.” The business center had two computers, but you have to pay to use them. The cost is 55 cents/minute with a minimum $5 charge. (4) Disadvantageous blackjack rules. At this casino, the dealer must hit a soft 17. This rule means that the dealer will get better winning hands, and the casino will take more of your money. I recommend trying to find a casino where the dealer must stand on a soft 17. There are a few casinos here and there that have that rule. If you can’t find a casino that has that rule, then it’s a good idea not to play blackjack at all. You will likely lose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off the Strip Casino Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dianne O
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palace Station for nearly 20 years and have never been dissapointed. Located just off the strip, it is quieter and less congested. The casino is a good size and not one that you could get lost in. The restaurants are fantastic, especially the Oyster Bar, with the best seafood I have tasted since living in New England. The Cafe' is inexpensive but with a nice atmosphere and great food. Very friendly staff and kind of a "homey" feel to everything. Free shuttle service to and from the airport and also to the Mall located next to the Wynn and the Encore, so getting to the strip is fast and no cost except a tip to the driver. Rooms are good size (Tower Rooms) and many have great views of the strip and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: I can safely say it's the best hotel in Las Vegas. The rooms are impeccable, and the service is great. The restaurants are the best and pancakes at 3:00 in the morning is the best way to go and what can i say about the gambling you will enjoy your stay . A.M.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding value!”
Reviews.Author: fotoman138
Reviews.Content: The Palace Station is a very nice and clean hotel, the property is beautifully decorated and lit, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, the staff is friendly and the Central Cafe restaurant is excellent. The Palace Station is a rare combination of quality at a modest price. Highly recommended. Location is actually great, right off the freeway very close to airport and the strip

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed at this hotel several times & enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: Kate A
Reviews.Content: Ok, first things first this hotel is not on the main "strip" but the advantage of this is that you don't get the noise assocoated with Vegas but you do get a brilliant view across Sin City. The hotel runs a shuttle service to the strip free of charge (just tip the drivers). The rooms and bathroom are a great size, large comfortable beds, big TV and friendly staff. I used to stay at this hotel when I was cabin crew & also returned while on holiday. It has local fast food outlets close by if you don't want to order room service etc, a gift shop, several pools, small casino and large breakfast hall (with lots of choice). If you need any waxing, nails or treatments while you are staying in this hotel there is a good beauty salon over the road from this hotel. The hotel can help you arrange taxi's, show tickets and limos during your stay. It has a fun glass lift which offers a great view! I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Dean R
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in this hotel for a conference... But, I found it "ok". Rooms were cheap and the slot machines didn't work correctly. I mean, I would go down with about $20 in my pocket and come back into the room with over $100, every night! I hit so many small payouts in this hotel I was able to take $600 extra home with me... That's after "O" tickets at $150 x 2 and Bellagio dinner. Can't explain it. :)

Reviews.Title: “one of the cheepest”
Reviews.Author: broy87
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the motel in back. this allows you to park close to your room. not all that hiking like when you stay in a tower. the rooms were nice, clean and comfortable. and cheep. just remember THERE IS A RESORT FEE OF 18.00 ADDAD to each room per nite so that does inflate the price a little

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the station we expected a clean 3 star hotel room. What we got was a run down, no elevator dump called the “Courtyard” which had a lovely view of a dumpster, and paper thin walls. At first I wanted to be positive and asked my wife to do the same. After all we were on vacation. But after trying to sleep on their plywood stuffed mattresses, my back screamed, “enough!!” We went to the front desk to complain about the room qualityand at first the receptionist was helpful. She informed us that the tower beds were so much better, but the manager would have to approve the transfer. We waited until the manager arrived and spoke with her. Her attitude was definitely not helpful. (She seemed to suspect we were trying to scam her or something I guess.) When I told her about the terrible beds she said, “All of the hotels beds were the same.” I responded that all of the beds were crap then. I was going to demand my money back, but my wife wanted to know where they had placed us first. They had downgraded us to the courtyard (dump) instead of the Tower room that we had prepaid for! When I confronted the manager about this a room in the tower “magically” opened up and they took 50 bucks off the bill (big deal) for trying to pull that crap I will not recommend this hotel to anyone (unless I hate them)

Reviews.Title: “Great Party”
Reviews.Author: Wolf F
Reviews.Content: The staff were top notch and egar to please. The buffet was excellent breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The super bowl party was fabulous, great food and drink, with a clear view of the game from anywhere in the room.

Reviews.Title: “hard to find room-beds are horrible,they are hard as a rock”
Reviews.Author: Yesenia E
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here today for Valentines Day with my couple & let me tell you the front desk people were really nice but the rooms were just not!!When I got there I thought I was going to stay in the main casino & no,,my room was all the way in the back outside of the casino in a seperate building/shack, I dont know what it was. I took forever to locate the room because this seperate building was just so confusing with no signs where the rooms were at,nothing. It took me a good 20-30 min to locate my room.There are no signs or arrows telling you the numbers of the rooms, you just have to wonder around till you find it!!!!! I had no sleep at all because the beds were as hard as a rock. Never had slept in a bed that was that hard!!!!I could hear all the people around the other rooms, literally like I had the people in the same room!!!There was noise all night long. I guess the walls are just so thin or I dont know but you can hear everything!!!!The lady cleaning the rooms got us up really early with her noise, im talking about 6-7 in the morning. We could hear the vacum that early like if she was cleaning our room. The layout of the building is so confusing, the hard bed, & the noise was just irritating,,just made it the worst hotel I have ever been to!!!!!!!!!!!The worst!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!If you ever plan to stay here,,,,,you are better of at a motel!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: John N
Reviews.Content: The worst with this hotel is the room is so small, smelly, and the sheets seem to be resued without washing, and worst of all you have to pay $16.97 per day for service charge for nothing, even no free wi-fi. I booked the court yard room for the supper bowl Sunday and Monday ($55 total through hotel.com). I checked in the hotel after the Super Bowl, and realized that it's even worse than a motel, so small, smelly, and dirty, which there is no way I can sleep in. I went to Rio and luckily got a room to stay for $40 that night. The next day I came back to Palace to check out and surprised by the chrage of $16.97 per day service charge on top of the full price I payed to Hotel.com for the room. Hotel.com advertised that there won't be any hidden fee, or cancelation fee, but it's not true at all. Watch out for the No-Refund deals. The Hotel.com and the hotel will try to get your money without providing what you are bargaining for. You are stuck in the middle of the town, and probably have to accept what-ever they throw at you. I saw a number of upset customers waiting to talk to the manager and she is trying to hide in her office. I wouldn't waste my time, moeny, and energy for such fools ever again...

Reviews.Title: “Was very happily surprised by the Palace Station Hotel and Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy Y
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day trade show in Las Vegas. Was a bit reluctant to stay at the Palace as I had a less than pleasant stay in the past. However after receiving a great "come back" offer I tried it again. Wow! I was so surprised! The Tower rooms were awesome. Nice and modern, clean and quiet at night after being on my feet all day. The Casino floor staff was always very nice and the restaurants had tasty food. I will definitively stay there next time and for all you doubters out there, give it a shot! Make sure you ask for the "Tower" rooms. You just wont beat the price vs. accommodations anywhere else I know of.

Reviews.Title: “Super Bowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Let me start saying that my wife and I are regular visitors to Vegas, we have stayed all over Vegas from The Hotel to Golden Nugget. This time we were kind of skeptical of what to expect from The Palace based on the reviews and the awesome deal we found for the super bowl weekend ($18 per night), but we were gladly surprised of what a great experience we had at the Palace. We were upgraded to the main tower and I glad we did because the rooms at the courtyard section looked like an average truck motel. Our room was very spacious, and at night or in our case in the early mornings had an awesome view of the strip. The casino although it is smaller than the ones on the strips or even at downtown, had all the slots, table games, and amenities that you would find in any Vegas casino. My husband made like $4,000 during the weekend playing craps, he mentioned that the poker room was below average with some of the rudest dealers in the business. Moving to the slots, I found that the machines at the Palace pay way more often that the ones on the strip. We watched the Super Bowl at their Mexican cantina and we had a blast. A pitcher of beer was $4 and the shots $1, plus the lady bartender is one of the best in the city. We would definitely come back again to the Station if the price is right, but overall it is an excellent choice for those of you that are traveling on a budget or don't want to deal with the madness of the strip on a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Meager Station”
Reviews.Author: Nyqwil
Reviews.Content: A real disappointment this trip considering how pleasant it was on the previous. Its bad enough that I was put in the older section of the hotel, not to mention that this is the second time I requested a standby upgrade that never happened. The bathroom was awful and small and the shower head rather low (ouch) for a person of my height. But to add insult to injury, at or about 1:30 am, some extraordinarily loud guests in the next room made it impossible to sleep. I understand this is Vegas, but after a long flight . . . Is there management or security that does a walk through to monitor these things? As if that wasn't bad enough, the following day there was an off again-on again power failure which made it impossible for my friend and I in the casino. Not sure how much I lost there but after the third outage, I realized that I was done in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “will stick to the strip”
Reviews.Author: mlc_33261
Reviews.Content: came here with a friend working for virgin atlantic as this is where the cabin crew stay. was only here a couple of nights so didnt really use the facilities as such. id been to vegas twice prevously and always stayed on the strip. the hotel itself was fine and the rooms were clean and comfortable but when i return next year ill def go back to staying on the strip as we found we were paying quite a lot in taxi fare to get us back and forward and for the extra money you can get a better hotel in a much better location. also, the surrounding area didnt seem all that great and not somewhere id wanna be in late at night!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade your stay”
Reviews.Author: CheapEats019
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our stay from a garden room to the tower.....what a difference. No noisy kids running the halls or loud folks looking for the friends or rooms. The resturants on the property vary from Johnny Rockets to a steak house. We have eaten at the cafe - lots to choose from, the mexican food is good but the staff is a bit slow. The seafood bar is excellent and worth the wait. We have stayed here several times now and this time was the best with the upgraded room.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expected or wanted”
Reviews.Author: joshbott
Reviews.Content: The coffee shop had a great menu and generous portions. They also had specials that were worthwhile. Now that I’ve said everything good I can say about Palace Station Hotel, let me give you my review. First you should know that the price you get from Hotels dot com is not the price you’ll end up paying. Be very careful to check the “small print”. There is a mandatory Resort Charge of $16.95 a day. This might be worthwhile if you don’t rent a car and need a shuttle to and from the airport, you have to have Wi-Fi in your room and you also are doing business and need copy and fax service. Otherwise, you have no choice but to pay the fee even if you have a non-refundable pre-paid reservation. After arguing with the front desk that I didn’t need any of the services, they took $5.00 a day. When we went over to the casino it was Smokey and very dated like the rooms we were in. It reminded me of years ago when you would go out for the night and when you came home and took off your shirt, it had this smell of cigarettes on it. I stayed in the courtyard rooms. The best thing in my opinion would be for the Palace Station to implode the Courtyard buildings. They have a card system to let you into the building and they didn’t always work. The view from the room was the wall from the part of the building. We did have a “peek-a-boo” view of the pool. The ceiling is “popcorn” style. There was no bedspread on the bed and the blanket was lightweight. The room was cold. They do have a heater in the room and it did eventually warm up the room. The TV was an old analog style TV and the remote looked filthy. The walls were so thin that we could hear the maid listening to the radio while she was cleaning the room earlier in the day and then was able to hear the whole TV show that the room next door was watching until 12:30 in the morning the night before we had a 5:00 wake up to make our flight out. I wouldn’t stay at the Palace Station again and wouldn’t recommend it to any of my friends. This is unfortunate as The Station Casinos has some really great properties other than the Palace Station.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: finni71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Station for 3 days. The general ambient of the hotel was brash and noisy day and night; apart from bed to lie on at night and generous free parking there is nothing else to write about this hotel. The foods on offer at the hotel are basic and of low quality; luckily there were few first class restaurants in a small shopping mall directly opposite the hotel on West Sahara Road. Nevertheless, Good Value!

Reviews.Title: “Average & too far from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Andy114
Reviews.Content: Decided to go with this place as I was in Vegas for 12 days and on a budget.. Cons: I wouldn't recommend this place if you're going to spend time on the strip.. you'll end up spending more on cabs just getting to and from the hotel which would make up the difference staying at nicer hotel on the strip... The shuttle bus leaves very infrequently, so I wouldn't rely on that for transportation. The gym is lackluster and really sub-standard (like most hotels I guess), however, the lady at concierge was nice enough to call up a health club and arrange some complimentary visits to the gym which was great! Showers/Bathrooms in the Courtyard rooms were a bit crappy.... but not bad enough to cry about. The Pros: They reduced the resort fee to $10 a night since I was there for 12 days, however, I upgraded to the tower room due to the Courtyard rooms being really average and motel-like (which was $20 extra per day). Food was actually pretty good considering the price at the main restaurant there and they have a Starbucks which is handy for the caffeine addicts. Staff were mostly quite friendly and helpful :-) I didn't use the pool but they had one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convenience Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Edward G
Reviews.Content: I deeply enjoy staying at the Palace Station because it is conveniently located at the entrance to the 15 freeway south and within a very short driving distance to Old Las Vegas (Fremont Experience) and the Las Vegas Strip Casinos. I definitely got the Las Vegas experience in all its splendor, WITHOUT the hassle of the traffic and people congestion, that is so typical of the Hotels directly located on the Strip itself. The accommodations are definitely a pleasant surprise, at a significant savings from the Strip Hotels. The beds are comfortable and cozy and the modern decor and flat screen TVs are what you would expect from a Casino Hotel that prides itself in pampering its guests. I highly recommend the Palace Station Casino for your visits to the city of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are handicapped!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Transportation to the strip was horrible!!!! Had to pre-arrange when I was going(like I always knew that!) At one time our bus had 2 or 3 times the number of people on it it was supposed to!!! Staff at the hotel were less than friendly. Really not good!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, Bad Booking”
Reviews.Author: Ken T
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at the Palace Station for years and this time was a pleasant surprise, the room was great, the people were more than friendly and the buffet was delicious The thing that ruined the whole trip was being blindsided by a sixteen dollar a day fee on a nonrefundable prepaid room. It was not the money it was the surprise, I WILL NOT BOOK THROUGH THIS SITE AGAIN Ken T.

Reviews.Title: “Another stay which was great!!”
Reviews.Author: Hema36
Reviews.Content: The Palace Station is a 'off Strip' hotel, which means it's not directly located at the Strip, but just next to exit 40 (Sahara Ave) from I-15. This very good when your are traveling by car from Los Angeles, Salt Lake City or just 'east to west' vice versa. The hotel is offering a shuttle every 1.5 hour down to the Strip which brings you to the Fashion Mall, directly located opposite Wynn and Encore hotels. Furtherone the hotel offers a shuttle running up and down to the airport in a convenient way. The entrance of the hotel is easy and the staff at the front desk is very friendly and helpful. The hotel has about 1000 rooms and suites divided in three categories: courtyard rooms, located around the swimming pools and parking lot. Tower rooms with views over Vegas and suites, also located in the towers. Prices vary upon season, weekday and occupancy. For example during CES (Consumer Electronic Show, mid january prices are higher). This was my fifth visit to Vegas and as well my fifth stay in Palace Station, although this is my first review for this hotel. I booked a suite which gave a nice view over Las Vegas. I used mainly the Feast buffer for breakfast ($4.99) and for dinner ($7.99); the choices are widespread and the food tastes nice. There are chefs around to have your wishes cooked directly like you wish. There are also other choices for restaurants to make in the Palace, but that's everyone's choice. The rooms are clean and well organized; the house-keeping does a good job. As mentioned earlier you have good access to the Strip by shuttle, and even the times are not convenient to you, you can take a taxi always for about $11. If there's any problem, the front desk is more than willing to help you. If you are looking for a nice, cozy place, please choose Palace Station; they offer good rooms for more than reasonable prices. It it really worth. Ralph Schurink, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Great stay away from the hustle and bustle...”
Reviews.Author: lowi05
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days with our 3 yr old daughter. Rooms were amble size, breakfast and lunch buffet are great value and plenty to choose from for every taste. Room was clean, though the linen old. For the price we paid absolute ok. Remember you only sleep. Hotel was not as smoky as others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time's At the Palace!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to the Palace Station for 32 years now,we have been on the strip many time's and it's fun but the Hotel's are so large,everytime we stay on the strip it just feel's like your just a #number.When we come to the palace station it just feel's like Home away from Home everyone remembers your name a Big Hi how are you or glad to see you agan what can i help you with to day.All the team members are on the same page to make you happy and comforable in every way on our stay thair.We have to hit the oyster bar at lease once,the combo pan roast is AWESOME a must.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station--a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights on a tournament offer in the Tower at Palace Station, and I was very happy with the accomadations. The room was a good size with a large wide-screen TV. I'm hoping they will consider adding small CV1 coffee makers to the rooms, but that's a small quibble. The newspaper at your door in the morning is a wonderful perk. The casino offers all the games you'd come to expect from a top notch facility and there are plenty of great pay schedules and reasonable table games. For the money and close proximity to all the exciting action in Las Vegas, you can't beat Palace Station.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a travel agent because it seemed to be the best value for the money. I'm a regular visitor to Las Vegas but the usual hotels I stay out were fully booked so thought I'd try this hotel out for the first time. Upon arriving at the hotel, there was one person waiting in line to check-in. It took a full hour for me to finish my check-in, and by then there was a significant line of others waiting to check in. I can only imagine how many hours they had to wait. In hearing the check-in clerk mumblings, seems they overbooked their hotel and didn't have enough rooms for everyone. In the end they honored my reservation by taking a room from someone else with a confirmed reservation. At check-in I was first told about the mandatory roughly $17 service charge. Even if I don't want or need the services, it had to be paid. With no other options, due to the other hotels being sold out, I was left with no other choice but to submit to this hotel's blatant thievery. Never again will I give any business to this bunch of crooks. Had they been honest and told me about the charge ahead of time and included it in the room rate, I would have never chosen this hotel as there were many of a much better value when calculating the total cost. I also noticed that part of the service charge is for their "free shuttle", but in looking at the schedule, it only leaves every couple of hours. Completely worthless. It's a shame that the Las Vegas / Nevada authorities don't arrest the hotel's executives and throw them in jail for their blatant fraud.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: thomas f
Reviews.Content: I booked my travel on bookit.com. The Palace Station was one of the hotels that came up. The price was right. The hotel was very clean from the outside to the rooms. I ate at the Buffet for breakfast & dinner. The buffet was small but the food was very good. If you stay at the Palace Station you should sign up for the Players club. With the Players Club you get $5.00 off at the Buffet. so breakfast is $4.99 & $9.99 for dinner. I would stay at the Palace Station again,

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT BIRTHDAY WEEKEND”
Reviews.Author: James Lucretia D
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have stayed at Palace Station many times and we are always surprised at how much fun we have and this time was even better. The front desk staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay better. IT was my birthday weekend and my Husband made the reservation and asked to have a room in the courtyard, HE parke the car while I checked in and to my surprise I was given a room in the Tower. This was an unexpected upgrade and we loved the room. So if you want to have a great experience book now.............

Reviews.Title: “Arrived late in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Denvertravler
Reviews.Content: Drove from Denver to Las Vegas and got a great deal for one night. $18 plus the "resort fee" which I wasn't surprised as this is the hotels version of the "fuel surcharge". We did not stay in the tower rooms, which are much newer. Glad that I only had to spend 12 hours here as the room, the bed was uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: uopercival
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical when I booked this hotel as it was the only 'cheap' hotel left during one of Vegas' largest conventions (CES). During this weeklong period, hotels charge tenfold what they normally charge. A normal $60-80/nt hotel on the strip goes up to $400-600+ during this event. I was able to get a tower room with flight from a travel site which made the room only $25 a night. Pretty incredible deal. There is however and additional $17 resort fee, most hotels charge for this anyway, the useful part of the $17 gives you wifi access. The tower room was clean, quiet and didn't stink of smoke. Do try to upgrade to the tower room, as the courtyard rooms have not been 'refreshed'. The staff was down to earth friendly, responsive and helpful. The hotel offers a decent breakfast buffet for $4.99, another deal that's hard to beat. They also have a free shuttle to the 'strip' - the drop off point being Fashion Show Mall as well as a free shuttle to the airport. I've stayed at the Monte Carlo, Luxor, Excalibur and the Aria and have to say that Palace Station rooms are on par with the rest (except maybe Aria). I would have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One step above sleeping on the street”
Reviews.Author: poohbear98
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that I hear the Tower Rooms are a whole other world. We stayed in the Courtyard and not only was our 'non-smoking' room oozing smoke from every surface but I came away with some kind of bug attack on my back. I never felt clean there. The carpet was tacky, the beds (full-size not queens) were extremely low to the ground and hard, the alarm clock's faceplate was peeling off, you could hear footsteps above, tvs from the neighboring rooms and every conversation from the hallway. You will not sleep well here. In addition, you better not like hot showers, the water was merely tepid. The bathroom looked like it was recently 'remodeled' which means that it had a newer tile floor and tiny granite sliver above the sink. The shower was about as big as something you'd see in an RV. Drop the soap and your butt pops out the shower curtain. We booked this room because of the price ($60/nt) and the free airport shuttle. I should have done more research. You check in and are immediately charged an extra $17/nt resort fee. Resort? Really? NOT. The shuttle runs every hour and half to the Fashion Mall but it was never there when it was supposed to be so we wound up sharing cabs every day. We only had breakfast at the Garden Cafe. It was decent and cheap but the hashbrowns had a rancid taste.Luckily no one got sick. I was completely grossed out during my entire stay. We called the frontdesk to ask if something could be done but the Tower was full. The most they could do was send housekeeping down to plug in an ionizer to try to fumigate the room. It didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Experience at Palace Station over the holidays”
Reviews.Author: kathy m
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful stay at Palace Station. We have been staying at Palace for over 35+ years and everytime it is worth it. We have a wonderful host who makes sure we are taking care of and we feel very special. We always have friends and family stay at Palace Station and we don't miss the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible start, Wonderful ending”
Reviews.Author: XtinaWalker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked online the Courtyard room and when we arrived were quite surprised to see that our room was outside the hotel/casino in a completely different building (looked like a motel 6) once we arrived into our room it smelled terrible, and had a lumpy bed..we spoke with the manager and after explaining we were celebrating my husbands bday and 1year anniversary he upgraded our room to the luxery petite suite (which was AMAZING) and he also waived the resort fee of $16 per night.. we were so grateful and this change completely made our vacation!! the buffet is AWESOME and they even let us use the hotel limo to take us back to the airport..after the room was situated it was an amazing experience ... but DO NOT BOOK THE COURTYARD <unless your standards are the motel 6!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room, Great View, Excellent Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Seamus F
Reviews.Content: My tower room was amazing, clean, and comfortable. The in-house restaurants were delicious, and the casino was just the right amount of busy (not so much that it becomes overwhelming, but not so barren as to be depressing). The staff were very helpful. Being off the strip was a little bit of a hassle, but I was never more than a 10 minute cab ride away from anywhere, and they provide a free shuttle. My friends who stayed on the strip payed three times as much for a much smaller room they were barely satisfied with. All in all it was a great value for the price. My only real complaint was that the room had a beautiful huge HD TV, but no HD content, alll programming was faded and stretched. But you don't really go to Vegas for the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: Nancy R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palace Station in the Luxury Tower Suites. The rooms were awesome. Very clean, comfortable beds and great sized bathrooms. We will definitely stay there again. The whole staff from front desk, cleaning personnel and valet etc were awesome. The prices in the restraunts were reasonably priced and food was very good. As stated before, will DEFINITELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sin City”
Reviews.Author: purpleheavenz
Reviews.Content: Lobby and Casino areas were very smoky not good for non smokers as you had to walk through casino to get to restaurants. Daily fee of $16 plus tax was a rip off. It covered shuttle, wifi and pool whether you used them or not. These should be included in cost of room, not as extras. Shuttle drivers still expected to be tipped. Complimentary toiletries were very nice. Everyone was friendly and hotel was conveniently located near local bus stops. A tip is to buy 24 hour passes on buses outside hotel for $5 on the strip they cost $7. Bus drivers are very helpful. Its worth riding around on buses to see the outer areas and to find cheaper shops. The heated outdoor pool and steaming hot Jacuzzi is a nice treat. Hated hotel food, not nice for vegetarians. Buffet did not differentiate between meat & non meat dishes. Hotel has small gift shop, can find basic items there.

Reviews.Title: “Fees make the booking price misleading”
Reviews.Author: MB6650
Reviews.Content: There are additional fees that will be charged to you to check out. Do not plan on having the good rates that you think you are going to pay. Nickel and dime you is their modus operandi, I felt like I got the old "bait and switch."

Reviews.Title: “Good off the strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: stbunco
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for price, got the upgrade to suite room for $75, but my room was only $18 at original price. Definately want to stay in the tower if you are there to spend time in your room. The courtyard rooms are for those who will not spend a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay if on budget.”
Reviews.Author: BigBang_P
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice and comfortable.No fridge, microwave or even coffee maker in the rooms. I found bathrooms Iil filthy, but dint mind it just for one night.They have a free shuttle to the strip and also to the airport if you don't have a car. if you have a car (like we did) , it's few miles from the strip. We booked courtyard rooms, and got it for $51 per night(for 4 ppl), resort fee of $ 16.50 charged separately by the hotel. It's just ok for one or two nights - its Vegas - you won't find much time in hotel anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Dont overlook offstrip hotels like Palace Station on your next trip”
Reviews.Author: UsedCarSalesman
Reviews.Content: In these economic times, it is nice to have choices. If you are accustomed to and still can afford a poolside cabana with attendants spritzing Evian on you and placing fresh cucumber slices on your eyes then don't book PS. If you are into a great value, unpretentious reasonably priced food and friendly service, by all means book PS. The Tower room I stayed in was clean, upscale with marbled bathrooms and large counter. It has wireless and LAN for those who need to work or catch up on emails and flat panel TV, iron, almost everything you need. Well, it didn't have a refrigerator or mini bar though. Humm. Casino. I found they had all the popular table games and a decent variety of slots from WMS, IGT, Konami and others. For those taking relatives or extended family, they have a small sports book, live Keno and let's not forget Bingo! If the strip beckons, take the shuttle or taxi. I found taxi fares averaged 15 bucks to Bellagio/Cosmo area. Strip properties are great but sometimes trying to get a simple drink or service from those cavernous, billion square feet megaliths can be daunting. Try a little down home, friendly comfortable place next time. Try Palace Station!

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I always have a good time!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tbone1208
Reviews.Content: We have the best casino host ever, (Leisa Wells) she makes us feel right at home, that's why we will always stay at Palace Station.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for hiden fees and cheap, bumpy beds.”
Reviews.Author: Garota88
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY HERE. I lived in Vegas and can tell you there are better, cheaper places to stay. The "amenities fee" is ridiculous and nearly doubles the room rate. Awful beds and apathetic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Las Vegas at the Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: Glee N
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Palace Station as a place to stay during your visit to Las Vegas. The rooms are clean, the entire staff were extremely guest friendly,very helpful, and their prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: swguy27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after I missed my connecting flight and was looking for a cheap room online. The website said 3 star, and that might be true for the tower rooms, but NOT for the Courtyard rooms!!!! I felt like I had just stepped into another world! My window was next to the trash compactor so I had to listen to the workers throwing garbage into it all night long. I had random "ladies of the night" knocking on my window at 2am. Also was woken up at 5am to hotel security knocking on everyones door looking for who knows what in the rooms. The shower is the most bizarre thing I've ever seen and nearly impossible for a full size adult to use effectively. There wasn't even a blanket on the bed, just a sheet. If you are prepared to get nearly no sleep and leave early the next morning, then this is the place for you! Also, the airport shuttle, (which is the only reason I picked this place) only runs every 1.5 hours after 8pm so I had to pay for a ride anyway! This is a 1 star property for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time was had by our group”
Reviews.Author: Buckey66
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Palace Station as a people friendly place, rooms in the tower were fine, and the staff throughout the Casino were extremely friendly & helpful, from resturant staff to the table game dealers. Our group will return to the Station on our next visit to Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Courtyard Rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorrie D
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at Palace Station. Overall we enjoyed our stay. We stayed in the Courtyard rooms and they have attempted to renovate them but they have some issues. In the bathroom the small pedastal sink has no room for your personal items. There was only one plug in the bathroom. The shower (no tub) is tile and looks good but is not functional. The shower curtain feels like it is attacking you while you shower. Our room had a king bed and there is very little floor space not taken up by the furniture. The furniture was old and beaten up. The heater was LOUD! The walls were very thin and you could hear everyone walking down the hall. My friends stayed in the tower and said the rooms were nice. The cafe was newly redone and beautiful. The new Pasta Cucina was a bit overpriced for average Italian food. The bars do comp drinks when playing the machines but use generic alcohol even when you call something like Captain Morgan. The staff was friendly and helpful, overall excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Week”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: Initially checked into a courtyard room and had an issue with it. Manager immediately resolved the issue and upgraded us to a tower room. Tower room was very nice, large bathroom, and a really nice place to stay. Bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. Will stay here again but only in the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station after Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Terry C
Reviews.Content: The Tower room was very nice and newly redesigned. The bathroom was clean. Great hotel for the money. Definitely a repeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, but ya get what ya pay for”
Reviews.Author: Purplealiene
Reviews.Content: So-so. As a Vegas 'local' I've been to several hotels. This one was kinda boring, okay if you're on business. If you want a faster paced scene, stay elsewhere. If you want low-key, this place is for you.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: cherylfyne
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the palace station 2 years in a row it is a great hotel for it not being on the strip very good buffet and you can win playing the slots. free shuttle service to the airport and the strip.cheap bingo we will stay there again on our next trip to las vegas

Reviews.Title: “Recently upgraded rooms, dated facility. Look for bargan pricing for off strip housing”
Reviews.Author: owenshiv
Reviews.Content: The GOOD : I stayed in this Art Deco, train station themed hotel a few years ago as a bargain price. I was impressed with the recent renovations to the Tower rooms and better air in the Casino. Pillow top beds, granite counter tops and tile showers and large flat screens really improve the look and comfort. Good temp control, Plenty of free parking, decent eateries (I suggest the Steamer Bar or Cafe) The hotel caters to locals and mature visitors. The Fair: No tub and the tile shower floor does not drain well and must be a chore to clean, if it is. No coffee maker and the casino while better than it use to be is still dark, low cealing and only ok air flow with a good deal of cigarette smoke. Buffett can be a deal at $5-10 but only so so quality. Stick with the breakfast for $5. The Poor: Only the tower has been upgraded. The Garden rooms remailn in 1980. Not much of a Pool area. Even in the tower the walls and door are still thin and noise carrys well. I could hear what sounded like pipes and the elevator all night as well as my neighbors using the Facilities and tv. There is also a less than $20 daily resort charge for things most of us will not use (shuttle, pool) also the internet charge is significant. Recomendations: Nice rooms in the tower, priced around $*** or less. If you find a good deal and don't mind driving to the strip its a decent home base but not a destination. Look for bargins.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Brysum
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Vegas very late due to my flight being delayed because of weather.... finally made it to the check in desk about 3:30 am and was upgraded to a suite because my original room was sold out... no complaints from me on that!!! Heck it didnt even require me to slip the check in desk employee my usual $20.00.... I do that trick A LOT and find that it works most of the time!!!! Never under estimate the power of a $20.00 bill..... The overall property is showing it's age but you are getting a good deal for staying a few blocks from the action at the heart of the strip. The suite was very clean and well appointed with nothing bad to say about it. check out my video walkthrough of the suite at: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FXS8xrSHTRc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Affordable Good Food Feast Buffett and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: JHappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend as excellent value for price of room, food and amenities. Courtyard Rooms are a good value and optional upgrade to tower rooms is offered. Feast Buffet all you can eat is good food and variety. Breakfast is $4.99 with everything also the option of omelets made to your liking. An all day Feast Buffet pass including breakfast, lunch and dinner is $20.00. Amenities include shuttle service from and to airport, shuttle service to and from the strip, in room WiFi, pool, hot tub and fitness center. If rooms are available early check-in for a fee. As we came in earlier in the day and took the shuttle from the airport this was worth the nominal fee. Station Casinos Boarding Pass sign up and its free for the best values. Enjoyed staying here and the great customer service. www.palacestation.com

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great!”
Reviews.Author: computerprofessor
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here when I went to Vegas. but no more. Rooms are OK, clean and nice. They were great when they kept the price down. They've upped their rates and added a $15 charge for things that should be free. That, and one of the worst buffet's in Vegas. I used to think that you couldn't mess up breakfast but they proved me wrong. I just made a reservation at the Gold Coast. Will post a review as soon as I get back.

Reviews.Title: “16th Floor Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: Badbusinessbureau
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my 5-night stay. When booking my room online, I read previous reviews and chose the Tower Rooms, and had no regrets. I had a Tower Room on the Non-Smoking 16th floor with a North View. It had 2 Queen beds, and the room was spacious. I requested a coffee maker, and it was delivered to the room within minutes of the request. Although it was a 1-cup at a time coffee maker. The maid service was excellent, keeping my room clean, bed changed, and plenty of coffee. The room temperature was 71F(21C) when I entered the room and I found it too warm, and reset it to 60F(16C), keeping the fan on low for much of my stay. I have back issues, and found the bed to be very comfortable and contours to my body. It was a 'Serta Presidential Suite' pillow-top mattress that was put there in April 2011. I checked the labels. The $14.99 Hotel fee includes the high speed internet. When you turn on your computer it will say there is a $5.99/day charge. I talked to the front desk about this and was told that it is charged to your room but then taken off your bill when you check-out. And they did take it off. But do remember to mention that to them when you check-out to make sure it happens. You also get a daily newspaper sitting outside your room door. It seems to be delivered around 2AM, although someone must have been taking mine as I didn't get one for the first 2 days of my 5 night stay. Convenient & friendly Shuttle service to and from the airport and Strip. The driver even helps by loading your baggage. The Buffet was plentiful and great taste. A good price as well. If you have the Stations Boarding Pass Card, you get a discount on the price. BUFFET TIP: Get the Dinner Buffet at the Lunch Price by going 20 minutes before Lunch is over. Then you pay the lunch price, and the Dinner Buffet is starting to be put out shortly thereafter. You can start with your soup/salad and then enjoy the Dinner Buffet. The Casino seems too be a favororite for Locals. I seen way more locals than hotel guests playing machines and tables. The average age seems to be 40-plus crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Get a tower room!”
Reviews.Author: hydromike
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. The tower rooms are a must. The Oyster Bar is a nifty place.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station rooms (Towers)”
Reviews.Author: 1jmiz
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the price and value. I am very particular about having a clean room. I understand this was a 3 star resort, so I was alittle worried. Overall nice room, and most important, it was clean. Bed was comfortable. Nice flat screen and not outdated. The overall casino had a feeling of a local resort. The Buffet not so good, Ok at best. Chinese restaruant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “3 day trip turned into 4 nights......”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly and accomodating. Clean and good security for comfort. Machines pay out fair. Oyster Bar is to die for..Grand Cafe chef needs attitude adjustment....Be careful of which room you can get, some have very small TV's...mine fortunately had a 42" LG. Not too many cahnnels to choose from, but had enough of the basics. Definitely will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully inviting from the moment I arrived. I stayed first in the courtyard rooms. Older, but very clean and well appointed. Although they were conveniently located they would have been more of a hike for my 89 year old mother in law who stayed with me on my second night. The staff went out of their way to upgrade my room for that night so that she would be close to an elevator. The employees were, without exception, courteous, helpful, and seemed to actually enjoy their jobs. The location was ideal for me as there was a shuttle to both the airport and the strip . . . without the congestion of the strip right outside your door. The price was reasonable and the stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Intelligent unasuming,friendly yet professional, enveloping casino environment, gambling the way it should be in a proven establ”
Reviews.Author: Mjriv
Reviews.Content: I'll be perfectly honest, i hate to tell the truth for fear the whole world will invade "our" casino. We've been going to vegas for 20 yrs. We have stayed @ palace almost every time. We've watched vegas supersize & contort. The frenetic fabrication has made most casinos impossible to gamble in with obnoxious loud music & thick bricks of slow moving tourists few of whom seem the least bit interested in gambling. "Our" palace station has stayed the course & remained a CASINO, loyal to the people who want a hotel/casino that cares. Palace has what we come to vegas for: personal suave gaming with experienced interested personnel. The hotel is clean. The food is good. We really appreciate this hotel for not giving in to the juvenile "Strip" mentality. Palace had people in their casino actually gambling & having fun...we could hear the pinging of the slots, we could hear the people, we could hear the different tv's & music from the different sources, my point is, the choice was ours and we spent most of our 5 days gambling & eating right in palace station & it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “palace station november 2011”
Reviews.Author: cripps555
Reviews.Content: the courtyard rooms are very convenient at this hotel they are both near to the pool and you can also park your car near to your room which is handy. The tower rooms on the other hand are of slightly better quality on this trip i was booked into a tower room i got the keys and rushed up to the room and the room was lovely but i wanted a room higher up so i could enjoy the view so went back down to reception and was given a better room (junior suite)with an amazing view.The lady also helped me set up my ipad to connect to the free wifi which was very helpful as i am useless at these things. The room was lovely and clean and there was plenty of towels in the bathroom for both of us the tv was was a huge flat screen. In the six times i have stayed at this place i have always had a lovely room with no problems. The only negative point i have with the palace is the same i have with evey place in vegas is that it is hard to find nice food as we are both vegetarian but when i told the chef at the buffet he was helpful and polite. All in all i would always stay here as it is very good value for money and very easy to get around town as it is just off the freeway and five minutes from the premium outlet centre and i won on their slots too :-).

Reviews.Title: “NEVER Again for Us!”
Reviews.Author: Kim R
Reviews.Content: This is a rating against other hotels; not some value per $ rating. Based on reviews here, we upgraded to the Tower. Got to our room (12003) and it hadn't been cleaned; called front desk. They got someone up to us in under 5 minutes with new keys to the top floor (21003). The top floor has what is supposed to be grander and nicer appointments (room size and shape was identical); they were OK. The bed is a SPRING mattress and you can F E E L each spring. My partner has a rash from the bedding scratching him so much! Room was cleaned, newspaper was delivered, etc. While the hotel says they are 2 blocks from the strip - you CANNOT walk! The shuttle runs to the strip every 90 minutes which is really not that often and accommodates ONLY 29 people. This was not an issue for us because we stayed during the week. Also, the shuttle's last run is 11:15 - which is too early. We ended up using taxis which was kind of expensive. We did get a rental car for one day; the rental car agency is NOT on sight so there is LOTS of waiting. Getting people is cars in the morning was NOT the priority for the rental car agency; hunting down cars to rent to people was the priority. Overall; NEVER AGAIN. Not worth the "savings". You can get better experiences elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie D
Reviews.Content: We booked a package online and were given a room in the Courtyard- which is in a separate building from the two towers. The room had a foul odor, was dirty and messy. When we opened up the window to let some fresh air in, there was no screen and the window half FELL OUT. It was gross. Luckily, we were able to upgrade- the staff were very courteous and helpful however I didn't feel we should have to pay. We got a room for $40 more a night in the towers. This room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: lisalogan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palace station veterans day weekend, I will never stay there again! Our room was dirty the tiles on the bathroom floor were loose and coming up! This place is a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Average Off-Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FitDude
Reviews.Content: My mid-week one night stay in a Tower Room was uneventful. Check-in was painfully slow, but the staff was at last very pleasant. The room in the Tower (high rise) was average size for Las Vegas, and while nothing special, it was clean, well maintained, quiet and the king size bed was comfortable. This hotel is located off the Strip, but offers shuttle service about every 90 minutes. The hotel is filled with plenty of places to eat, all of which offer typical Vegas fare. Prior to check-in I registered for the hotel’s on-line promotion offering a room upgrade for just $7 per night, in lieu of a basic room in the Courtyard (low rise) building. Although I did not see the rooms in the Courtyard building, it does appear to be a “lower” end portion of the project when compared to the Tower. The hotel imposes the dreaded Resort Fee ($16 per day) which includes in-room wi-fi, shuttle service both to and from the Strip, as well as the airport. The gym is a small very bare bones facility which consists of a couple well worn treadmills, bicycle, elipitical trainer, and complete set of dumbbells. For average economy accommodations off the Strip, Palace Station is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “very good value 4 money”
Reviews.Author: porgiamor
Reviews.Content: booked priceline for outstanding deal with car rental. airfare was my airmiles rewards whoo-hoo. best part was the convenient shuttle bus from hotel to fashion show mall, so i only used car for a few excursions including grand canyon which i highly recommend. great value for money. food was good for reasonable price and there were always lots of breakfast/lunch/dinner specials advertised. keep in mind this is not the mirage/mgm grand you get what you pay for. next time i won't even reat a car because the hotel provides shuttle to/from airport as well. my last day on the strip i found superman lol!

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station Stay Was A Pure Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: pipestud
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for three nights at the Palace Station Hotel and Casino. I was there on a combination business/pleasure trip as part of the West Coast pipe Show Convention. The hotel staff that took care of us at the convention were professional and very curteous and helpful. The show was a smashing success thanks to them! My hotel room was also super clean and the maid service was impressive as they were unobtrusive and thorough. Plenty of amenities as well. Just an overall terrific experience and I doubt I'd want to stay anywhere else on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Tower rooms only, don't even consider the older rooms.”
Reviews.Author: chino53
Reviews.Content: Value, but off the strip & be sure to add in the $15 per day "resort fee" bacause the price they quote you doesn't include it. Almost every chain hotel has free wireless, a pool and free local calls, this is not worthy of a resort fee. We found the beds to be too soft for our backs and this caused a slight back ache. The casino is bright and clean but a long walk from front to back. The pays on the video poker are good The pool is small and a long walk from the tower room across the casino with NO CHANGING ROOM. Res

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: timingcrossing
Reviews.Content: I stayed that for two nights. Room is clean and quite even though is it not a highrides, and fancy. But It is confortable. Beds are confortablle too. I would be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: 1Peipei1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic for the price. The airport shuttle services were great also. Rooms average for a hotel, but since it was hostel pricing, it was fantastic. Much exceeded expectations, would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed The Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: finnie2
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying in the Palace Station tower and we had a good stay. The room amenities and decor remind us of a Holiday Inn. The room was well cleaned each day and we did not hear a sound from above, beside, or in the hallway. There is a nice view of the strip or downtown from the higher floors. The only thing that made us cranky is that on top of the room rate is the "resort fee" of nearly $17.00 per night ($15 plus tax) - we were aware of it and factored it in. For that, as the list in our room stated, you get: use of the pool (isn't that usually included anyway - it is an adequate but not fancy pool area), use of gym (again, smaller but adequate), in room internet, free phone calls, free daily newspaper left at the door, and a shuttle to the strip running several times daily. We have never stayed in the 2 story courtyard rooms, which are plainer and cheaper but have the same resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “I've only stayed in the towers.”
Reviews.Author: chris f
Reviews.Content: I've only stayed in the towers rooms. The beer was cheap the casino was quaint with no frills. When I'm looking to gamble this is what I perfer. They had 2 pools and a gym. I ran from here to stratosphere and back for fitness and it was close. Well worth it if you like off strip casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family”
Reviews.Author: Brittany T
Reviews.Content: I loved getting to this hotel by their shuttle service from the airport and everyone was very helpful with our late check in and children needing to crash in their room quickly. Loved being off the strip. Great pool and easy to walk to surrounding things as well.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: beverly p
Reviews.Content: We been going to Vegas at least once a year for the past 30 years. We use to try different places but since we found Palace Station, that's the only place we stay. We made some "friends" at the pool and try to pick the same week as them to visit. The rooms and public areas are always clean. We feel safe even in the courtyard area. The staff is very friendly, especially in the poker room. They have a lot of locals who play and they are like one big happy family, yet welcoming to us visitors. We sometimes walk into one of the expensive hotels on the strip and the atmosphere is entirely different. Bev p

Reviews.Title: “palace station. las vegas”
Reviews.Author: mobrit
Reviews.Content: just flew into las vegas from england on my way home to los angeles. we only stayed one night at the palace station but wished we could have stayed more. the room was so clean and restfull, great large tv and comfortable bed. the staff was so nice and calm after a long flight that stressed us out. we had the breakfast buffet the next morning, the food was tasty, lots of different things and everything was piping hot including the thermos of coffee. we cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: EJG55
Reviews.Content: I was here on business for 3 nights. Very comfortable and clean room in the Tower. Nice remodeling gave it a classier feel than some of the higher end places I've stayed in LV. Bed was quite comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. Lots of good eating options, and Jack's Irish Pub was great. The breakfasts at the Grand Cafe were superb. Our business meeting was at the Palace as well, and the meeting rooms were both spacious and comfortable. My only gripe--and it's not much of one--was that everywhere you wanted to go seemed to force you into and through the casino (unless you went outside). The smoke from the casino was a tad grating, but that goes with the territory I suppose. All in all, a nice place, at a great value. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Artcraft6466
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable rooms. I would recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing niggles left me annoyed”
Reviews.Author: Silverpablito
Reviews.Content: To be fair we got off to a bad start. My wife was supposed to have booked a luxury room in the Tower but booked a Courtyard Room by mistake. The Courtyard room was disappointing and really no different to any very average motel. Unlike motels however there were no coffee/tea facilities in the room, no fridge or microwave. On bookings.com it states the room had a safe, but it didn't. I was aware that apart from the reasonable room rate there was a daily charge of $15.99 covering high speed internet, a shuttle bus to the strip, free local calls etc. When you try and log onto the internet however it pops up a screen asking you if you want high speed internet access ($12.99 per day) or slow speed internet access ($5.99.) I ring reception and ask what this means. Two phone calls later I find out that the $15.99 daily charge includes slow speed internet but if you want high speed access it will cost you another $12.99. So the claim that the daily charge includes high speed internet access is not true. I just find it annoying that anywhere these days is charging for internet access at all. There is no breakfast included at the hotel as one reviewer stated. The hotel is supposed to be about 600 yards from one end of the Strip and three miles from the other. We decided to walk to the strip. Now, I do understand walking anywhere in the States is an alien culture and never easy but you cannot walk directly to the Strip as it involves going over the freeway which pedestrians cannot do. Ended up walking three miles to the other end of the Strip. So we learnt that it makes sense to use the free shuttle bus included in the daily charge. Next evening we went to get the shuttle bus at 8pm and arrived 5 minutes before. There were about a dozen other people waiting for it. At 8.10 no sign of the bus, I go to reception and get told it may be late. 8.20 still no bus, I go to reception and get told if it was full it would have left early. So I ask if it will come back and do a second trip for all the other people waiting? No, it won't. So we have to get a taxi to the Strip. On a positive note the casino is as good as most on the strip. Alot of non hotel guests obviously come to the casino making good use of the large free car park. We had a very nice meal in the pasta restaurant in the hotel which was also very reasonably priced. Eating on the strip is very expensive. The room was clean and well serviced. On leaving the hotel I had a moan about the internet access and the shuttle bus and the receptionist deducted the daily charges.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap rooms are mediocre for LV, but decent weekend value”
Reviews.Author: Kolob64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the older cheaper rooms because we were coming through on the weekend. Mid-week the Tuscan Inn is better, but out of my price range for a Friday night. The rooms are not well ventilated at all and have heavy hotel room odor. I thought I had made a terrible mistake until we ate at the Chinese restaurant in the Casino. Since we were passing through on a long drive I did not want to go far. The food was totally amazing and truly authentic. Most patrons were Chinese. The Scallops in Pepper were incredible. The breakfast at their cafe in the morning was way above par.

Reviews.Title: “good deal”
Reviews.Author: hanazo
