Reviews.Content: Hotel is little off the strip. But don't worry, Friendly shattle driver will pick you up. Much I paid price. I got double service. Room is very clean, bathroom is very clean. why pay more high price for other hotel. Philipino cocktail waitless is very friendly. Keep coming back for more cocktail. I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Nice, calm and off the strip”
Reviews.Author: HILDA R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Station for the first time, it was a last minute trip. The Palace Station had great prices for a Saturday stay! The hotel is clean, safe and had all of the amenities. The check-in process was smooth and quick. We got our room at 10am, how good is that?! I will for sure stay there on my next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Freindly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Palace Station. We enjoyed it as well or better than our first. had not been there for several months but several of the employees recognized us and spoke. This is almost unheard of in todays hustle and bustle world. We will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the strip but very easily reachable by car. No thrills but being quite lowpriced it is ok. We did not try the restaurants, only the buffeets which were ok but nothing fancy. During our stay in June the lines to buffet were pretty long, 5-10 mins just to get in. Pretty much cafeteria type of atmosphere which corresponds to prices. Very easy access by car to just about anywhere. Pool area small and not really very tempting Good place to stop over for 1-2 nights, not really a place where you would like spend a longer holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town”
Reviews.Author: DACook19
Reviews.Content: $29 / night with breakfast buffet INCLUDED. Great deal. All of the staff was very curteous. The deals were very helpful willing to teach us new games. It was nice to slow down the pace of the strip a couple of nights & still have all the games & food that we wanted. The rewards 3X points allows quick reward earnings.

Reviews.Title: “Best place off the strip!!”
Reviews.Author: MelanieAndrews
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a variety of things for customers to do while staying in Las Vegas. The rooms are clean and neat. The location is convenient and easy to get to the strip if need be. They offer shuttle service to the strip and the airport. I've always had a great time staying here. There is even a Starbucks in the hotel, right next to the gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: stevestevesteve_11
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for two reasons: (1) it was cheap, and (2) my friend was attending a conference there. We stayed in the more expensive "luxury tower" rooms, which were still dirt cheap (but there's a mandatory "resort fee" - be sure to check the fine print!). The rooms were clean and the staff were pleasant. The wireless internet was needlessly confusing - you can use the slower rate for a low price [which actually means zero because it's included in the resort fee] or a higher price [which isn't included]. If we go to the same conference next year, we'll probably stay here again and have no complaints but otherwise there are huge advantages to staying right on the strip. (The free shuttle to the strip goes every hour and half.) If you can find a clean, pleasant hotel on the strip for only a little bit more you should probably take it.

Reviews.Title: “great trip to vegas”
Reviews.Author: tim d
Reviews.Content: The Palace Station was recommended by a friend so i tried it out. Had a great time. Staff was great from the front desk to valet. Wait staff in the resteraunts was great too. Nice, clean room, had a good time in the casino as well. Paid for my trip with a little left over to take home. Come on out stay a night or a week and have a good time. Freeway close and easy to find. Cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use the ATM or eat here”
Reviews.Author: marilynbphoto
Reviews.Content: The ATM did not dispense cash. When I asked for help, a person came along, Assured me the transaction did not happen and threw a card at me said they could not help me. The transaction is now under dispute as they lied to me. Food is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dovealove
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at Palace Station. First off they gave us a free upgrade to a suite. The room had more than enough space, it was very clean and did not smell of smoke. We had everything wee needed right under one roof. Since this was our first visit to Vegas we went out and saw some of the other hotels and I have to say I was very pleased with our choice and the price we paid for it. It is not located on the strip which is a good thing for me because it was easy access and rather quite but it was close and very easy to get to the strip. The hotel has a couple of restaurants that are open 24 hours and has a variety of other restaurants that stay open late. Very nice and we would stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Palace station hotel - We enjoyed a five night stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine F
Reviews.Content: We enjoy going to Las Vegas and for many years now have had the pleasure of staying at the Palace Station. We always stay in the court yard and love it there. The rooms are not the largest room, but when I'm in Vegas I'm not spending alot of time in my room. Our room has always been clean and the bed is comfy. The house keepers will bring you anything you need, hangers etc. We enjoy visiting the larger casinos but we always feel like were going home when we return to our room. If your expecting fancy go to the other larger more pricey hotels. If you want an over all less expensive place where the people are very nice go the the Palace. We have never been dissapointed and will most likley return next year. Why spend your money to sleep when there is so much else to do while your in Las Vegas. Oh and the pool is heated.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: milford44
Reviews.Content: The renovated tower rooms are very nice- large flat screen TV's, nice tiled walk in shower, nice comfortable beds. Restaurant near Casino is open for a great cheap breakfast. Casino has reasonable table limits.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: ProudSenior
Reviews.Content: Price was misleading - upon checkin we had to pay a service fee for shuttle service and internet connectivity which we did not want. Will never stay here again and will may not use Trip Advisor again since the fee wasn't disclosed in the posted room price. Hotel rate was very misleading. What was supposed to be a great valuse turned out to be far from it.

Reviews.Title: “Good business base”
Reviews.Author: SAEOE
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for a trade show and conference at the Sands Expo Center. Booked a cheap room online, which turned out to be in the old motel section but which had been nicely redone, so no problem there. Only negatives were no view and confusing hallway network to and from the parking lot and casino. Fortunately, a business contact got me an upgrade to a Tower room, which had a great view of the Strip, big flat-screen TV and was definitely the better room. Big plus was the location, which allowed faster driving alternatives to the crowded I-15 and Strip routes, both to and from the Sands and elsewhere around town. Culinary highlight at the Palace Station was the Oyster Bar, which has great New Orleans-style seafood dishes and all-counter seating, good when dining alone. Didn't play much in the casino, basically bought a Starbucks and relaxed at the keno lounge area. All in all a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: ErnieE415
Reviews.Content: Palace Station is a very nice a pleasant place to stay in Vegas...The towers rooms are nice, big , and very clean.. If you are handy capped be sure and let the front desk know in advance because the courtyard building is not set up for wheelchairs or elevators..But again I reccommend Palace Station for a very nice stay in Vegas..........

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Mihael G
Reviews.Content: We didn't expect such a nice hotel nad so big room. The view was OK. Big and nice bathroom. Could have a free internet. Parking and shops were close.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, friendly and fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: GrammaOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite Vegas places to stay is at the Palace Station. It's not gigantic like the Strip Hotels, yet it has all of the amenities -good food, great gaming, and free shuttle service to Fashion Show mall and the airport. You'll also get wired/wireless internet, local and domestic long distance calls, fitness center access, daily paper, copy and fax services. We love Louie Anderson and originally chose to stay here because we were coming to see his show. We've been hooked on the Palace ever since that first stay. I enjoy walking for exercise and have developed a two mile walk on the premises and in the immediate neighborhood; I swim too and the 2 pools here are usually uncrowded at the time of day I use them (mornings). They also have a jacuzzi pool. Starbucks is on the premises, as well as a buffet, EXCELLENT Chinese/Cantonese food, great Mexican, a burger joint, an oyster bar, Irish pub and I think maybe even a subway. Food a plenty! Try the Palace -you'll like it!

Reviews.Title: “Standard, not great”
Reviews.Author: SantinoBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: Pros: -At this hotel, we found nice and friendly staff, check-in was a breeze. -Food was pretty good and reasonably priced. -Housekeeping is good. My towels were changed and bed was made properly. -Great value for the money you pay. Cons: -Rooms are old and a bit depressing. -Its not very far from the strip but you need your own vehicle because the shuttle service is limited. -Unimpressive pool. Would definitely stay again for a budget holiday. It's a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: poepoe
Reviews.Content: Be aware that the hotel has an ammenities fee before you book, however the prices are still a great value. We just got back on 10/6/11 from a week stay and the room was comfortable. We did get a view of the Parking garage wall out the window which was the worse view we had in over 5 years of 2x/yr stays though. Another thing, watch your bill. We had opted on our internet reservation that we made on the Palace Station site to have a "Standby upgrade" and were charged for this even though it never happened. The desk clerk said that she would have the supervisor call me, but guess what ? 2 days later it has not happened. Guess I will do what I do when not pleased--write an email to the manager. It was not alot of money but it is the principle. The tower rooms have elevator but not the courtyard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Home . . .”
Reviews.Author: KLStan
Reviews.Content: Love to stay at Palace Station, have been for over 15 years. It's like being @ home - comfortable. Everyone is extremely friendly & helpful. Toni T. is the best Slot Host ever! Excellent food @ reasonable prices. Lots of different games to choose & I have my best "luck" here.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: ROCHELLEDAVIS
Reviews.Content: Our stays at Palace Station are always a pleasure because of the people on your staff. I can't think of any other place we have stayed in the past where the employees go out of their way to make sure that your stay is a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept We look for clean place when we travel”
Reviews.Author: Robert F
Reviews.Content: Employees and owners appear to take good care of the premises and the staff are alway help full, I would like to see more update slots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: gooder2121
Reviews.Content: Have been staying here for over 20 years and always have a nice experience. Off the strip and super easy access to the fwy. Shuttle back and forth to the strip. Great Oyster Bar

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Patti1030
Reviews.Content: Have visited the casino in the past but have never stayed. Very, Very pleased with the entire 3 nights we stayed. Tower room very cozy and extremely clean. The entire staff from the front desk, maid service, casino floor to all restaurant staff, were very friendly and extremely courteous. We are going to be back for sure and would recommend to all our friends. Thank you again for a great stay and look forward to our return. ;)

Reviews.Title: “I should have known better - What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Nick M
Reviews.Content: Reserved and stayed here last weekend, Sept. 23-25. The rooms they put us in were in the "Courtyard" area in the back of the hotel. This was, bar none, one of the absolute worst dumps I have had the pleasure of staying at, anywhere in Las Vegas. I was coming from Harrah's, and was very disgusted when I saw this place. The "Courtyard" rooms are nothing more than a modified "Motel 6" or "Super 8" type buildings. This is a very old structure, which is musty, and is many years old. It is a two-story building with no elevator; only stairs, so be warned if you have lots of bags. It was like they took an old Motel, and moved it in back of the Palace Station tower. It just did not belong there. Upon arrival, both rooms that I had reserved did not have functioning Internet access. One of the rooms had a very strong "medicine" type odor. The second room smelled very musty, and like it was a former smokers room. I had requested non-smoking. The carpet was worn, and also had several stains on it. The front desk was told to change both rooms, at my request as they were unacceptable to stay in. The replacement rooms had working Internet, but were definitely not to the expectations you would find elsewhere in Las Vegas. Even though my reservation was for two nights, the rooms keys for both my rooms were shut off the following day. My guest and I were locked out of our rooms. Upon calling the front desk about this problem, their solution was to dispatch their Security guards to make sure we were supposed to be there. The Palace Station security guards gave us the third degree, and told us we needed to make the long walk back to the front desk to resolve the key problem even though we were not fully ready, or had taken a shower yet. Between the structure, casino/hotel clientele, and condition of this place, I should have known better. Palace Station is definitely the kind of hotel you would put into the "budget" or "low budget" category. I have stayed at many Motel 6 and Super 8 type places, and this one is about par, or sub-par with those types of places.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station Vacation - Las-Vegas, NV”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are no strangers to Palace Station Hotel & Casino. We have stayed there several times with absolutely no problems at all. We have also stayed at Caesars Palace, RIO, MGM, Excalaber, Tropicana and Golden Nugget. I have probably forgot a few. We love staying at Palace Station, It is off the strip and like an Oasis all by itself, I always rent a car but there is no need to, they have shuttle service runing every 15min. to all the strip locations, also a free shuttle service to the airport. At check in my casino hoste checked us in right with no delay. The valet picked up our car and brought our bags in. They stored them until we were ready for them. A great thing they have for handicape people is they rent electric scooters, which I picked up one right awat. My wife and I went to our room and had a wonderful suprise. We called the bellman and he immediately brough our bags up to the room. After unpacking we went down to the Grande Cafe and had a wonderful meal. The food at the Grand Cafe, Oyster Bar, Ital. Rest, and the Broiler Rood are all EXCELLENT. The Prime Rib with the bone in is like getting a side of beff on your plate and cooked to perfection. My wife could not eat 1/2 of her order but I did not eat the shrimp cocktail or the baked potatoe, or salad and I was almost able to finish the whole thing.(YUM YUM) The casino is most exciteing, the dealers keep you happy, they actually talk unlike most casino's they just deal the cards and that it. The cocktail waitress is very good, keeps your drinks full. The room service was excellent, we ordered Pizza and it was hot and excellent (the waiter must have run from the kithen because the pizza was so hot you could not pick it up) most days we have lunch at the Oyster Bar, You would think you were in Boston it is so good. I always had to have the clam chowder with a dozed raw oysters. YOU HAVE TO TRY THIS!!! We had a wonderful time at the swimming pool, the water was warm and the service was excellent!!! You must have a pinacoloda and lay back and injoy the shade or sun which ever you wish, you think you were in the Bahamas. not much more I can say but the room was excelent, plenty of towels and shampoo, conditionar, tooth brush, tooth paste, bath crystals and so much more in the bathroom to list. The TV was also excellent but did not see much of it, can watch it at home.

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: kim s
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Las Vegas for her birthday. We stayed at the Palace Station and found it to be very nice! We both were surprised at how nice it was for the value. Thanks for a great stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Vacation week in Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: Bridgette333
Reviews.Content: Convenient parking garage. Clean room. Stay in the tower. Great food in the Grand Cafe and Cabo's (the Mexian restaurant). Fun slots! Enjoyed the pool. Loved Starbucks. Good gift shop. We always stay at Palace Station for it's parking conveniece (we rent a car for sightseeing day trips), dependability, cleanliness, and fun for many years now.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at the Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: J U
Reviews.Content: When I first heard we were staying at the Palace Station, I thought it was one of the old hotels in downtown Las Vegas. I wasn't expecting much, but when I saw the welcoming signage announcing Palace Station, I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised. It was only around 9 a.m. so I thought I would have to store my bags and have a little breakfast before check-in. The staff was more than happy to check me in early and fill me in on where to go and what to see. The room was fantastic - lots of space, great views and lighting. The staff and food at the Grand Cafe were terrific. The steak and lobster special at The Broiler was excellent. My last part of the vacation was at the MGM Grand. I was suprised that the room and atmosphere was not as nice as Palace Station. I would highly recommend the Palace Station. Free shuttle to and from the airport. Can't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Something for Everyone!”
Reviews.Author: TFitz134
Reviews.Content: Nice layout, good key service, attentive & polite staff. Thet have a nice variety of food & a wonderful comedy show.

Reviews.Title: “Heartbreak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mickeymodem
Reviews.Content: I really can't agree with alot of the reviews on here about this being excellent, unless that is, the folk writing them are gamblers who get that little bit of extra attention because their spending obscene amounts of money at the casino. Set outside the strip, at first glance this looks like anyother city hotel; faceless, non-descript concrete and dour design. It's key attraction is (as you might expect in Vegas) its casino. Set near to the main highway and on the flightpath to Vegas airport its more akin with a Heathrow Airport hotel than any desert break. As you walk through the doors be sure and inhale the stale cigarette smoke that greets you in the lobby and be sure to hold your breath as you walk by the several smokers sat outside. Banal music wafts into your ears as you enter the place. Inside, it's easy to see gaggles of staff just standing around being busy doing nothing - perhaps the whole day through. (sorry to wax lyrical) Approach the desk to book in and some lady tells you that your room isn't ready- when you ask how long she says that she has no way of contacting anyone and can't tell anyone to make it sanppy as the guest is waiting. Come back in 30 mins. when she then tells you its still not ready but she can put you in a queen sized room at no extra charge: Excuse me, I 've reserved and paid for a King sized room! I speak to my partner and then attempt to go back to her - she ignores me and serves someone else. So, guess what?, yep! I went to another lady who without being asked suggested she make a call to find out the status of my room (What was that about - that other lady told me - she had no way of contacting anyone)?? Well, the room wasn't ready, but hey wait a minute - she had a look on the computer told me it wasn't a problem there was another king in the same block that would do nicely. But then a slight sting in the tail - I would have to pay just under $17 dollars a day for "...use of the amenities..." Strange I didn't recall being told this when I booked on line. Amenties? oh yeah, thats the use of the pool, the internet and shuttle bus - that kind of thing. Well by this time you're well and truly hooked; wriggle as much as you want, but you can't get away. The room was clean but the net curtains had to remain drawn all of the time as our room looked directly onto the multi storey car park. If I had been Batman, Robin, Superman or some other comic hero I could have jumped the gap between the two - thats how close it was. The room was otherwise comfortable and satifactory There was, however, one saving grace: The Cafe Grande on the ground floor was excellent, staff courteous and friendly and the food first class. If you take my advice - you'll pop here for something to eat and spend the money on a decent hotel elsewhere.As the saying goes "You get what you pay for"

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Time!”
Reviews.Author: PETE S
Reviews.Content: A Friend was getting married, went to Palace station and had an AWESOME time! Gambled the whole time without losing too much.... went to a concert, a hypnotist show, learned how to play craps... ate like a king! Thanks Palace Station! I'll tell my friends about you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and positive experience”
Reviews.Author: Glenda F
Reviews.Content: I get little time off in the summer to relax and set aside my hectic career. From the moment I stepped onto the airport shuttle till the time I stepped off and was on my way home this experience was just what I needed. I work in the hospitality industry and I was very impressed with the friendliness of all the staff. Guest Services were very accommodating and met our every request. The room and bathroom was updated and immaculate. Our group met for breakfast at the buffet and were able to enjoy a delicious variety of breakfast foods even down to the fresh made eggs and omelets as we sat and visited in a clean, enjoyable atmosphere. The Place Station is a little way off the strip but a shuttle bus is provided to take you down there. We did not rent a car but it was not a problem because the hotel management has thought of everything. Thank you Palace Station for a wonderful stay, I will share my experience and I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: mailman111111111
Reviews.Content: The best part was rolling out of the comfy bed and having the feast buffet right at our own hotel. The housekeeping was a little lacking. They went two days without touching our room twice. We stayed nine days.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne G
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Palace station and was very happy with the experience overall. I stayed in a luxury tower room with city view. The room was immaculate, toilets and bathroom clean. The staff more than willing to assist you. There were many discounts I could use in the restaurants downstairs. They also provide courtesy busses to and from the airport and to and from the strip (which is less than 5min drive). Most tour companies will pick you up from this location. A friendly atmosphere. I will certainly stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean quiet and modern inside rooms”
Reviews.Author: 1998rc
Reviews.Content: This was a great price. We stayed for one night and were surprised when we saw the updated rooms. We stayed in the least expensive rooms, the courtyard rooms, and it was nice. At first we thought the place looked old and the room would be the same, only to find the rooms updated with nice modern tiled showers sink etc with moen bath fixtures. Bed was comfy and room was overall clean. The hotel provided soaps shampoo and lotions as would any other major hotel in Vegas. The location was near the freeway and our room was on the freeway side however never heard it in the room. Off the strip and easy access. Not the normal overcrowded casino of the strip. Will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I had a Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: wendy j
Reviews.Content: I love the Palace Station!!!! I have the best VIP HOST, Lisa and Allan they make sure your stay is comfortable. The rooms are very clean and and nice on the eyes! When you come make sure you visit the Oyster Bar it is fantastic!!!! and delicious...My boyfriend use to be a Hilton guy but now he loves the Palace Station!!! Thanks Palace Station

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: miesha m
Reviews.Content: They were absolutley wonderful! It was a mother and daughter trip and the staff made it a fabulous trip. They made special accomidations so that we could stay close to each other and the room was great. This was my second stay there and always a pleasure. Great rooms, wonderful service and even better price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: susansba
Reviews.Content: I requested accommodations at the desk because I was in town for a family emergency and this hotel was close by. I am embarrassed to quote the rate I was given as it was less than parking at some hotels. Nice quiet room that was clean and comfortable and considering it was close to the freeway, remarkably quiet and peaceful. The food options were very much appreciated as there were many vegetarian and healthy choices in the cafe and buffet. Prices were very good for the quality and amount. Slept well, ate well and was treated with courtesy and professionalism. This was a fine location, bargain and pleasure. I will surely return this year.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky old hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl181747
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for with this property. Had to cross dark alley to get to room and once we got there, the non-smoking room was a bit smoky. The bathroom was updated though and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Communication and Delivery”
Reviews.Author: Osobad
Reviews.Content: After a bad experience at the Tuscany Suites last week, this week I called the hotel and ask very specific questions. Heavy emphasis on wireless and coffee makers. After being assured wireless in the room was included in the $14.99 resort fee and that if he requested a coffee maker one would be brought to his room, I booked the room. Husband arrives and asks for coffee maker to be brought to his room. He was informed that service was only provided for the more expensive Tower Rooms not the courtyard room. Again never told this at the time I called. Small explosion occurs and they upgrade him to the Towers at no cost. Only problem is he was booked in a King Room and is now put in a Queen. Starts to sign on to the internet and is required to agree to a $5.99 fee. Enough and he calls me and asks me to get it straightened out. The internet is indeed free thye tell me but he has to agree to the $5.99 fee in order to acess it, big promise that it won't be charged, we'll see. As a note there are two choices, $5.99 and $7.99 if you click on the $7.99 you will be charged. The girl at the front desk explains that is the cost for their non complimentary wireless. OK, confusing? First of all when you are paying 14.99 resort fee to get your wireless I'm not sure you can call it complimentary. Final note he had to call down three times to get the coffee pot brought up. If you want a refrigerator in your room that is an extra $10.00 a night. AGAIN DO NOT BOOK IN VEGAS UNTIL YOU KNOW WHAT YOUR GETTING. Resort fees can exceed $20.00 per night and most often do not include your internet.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn quality”
Reviews.Author: akchess_2000
Reviews.Content: Straightforward accommodations. We stayed in the "courtyard" which is a three story motel like structure behind the main tower. The room was fine and a fairly good deal for the price. There is a strip and airport shuttle which is nice as renting a car or only using cabs can be very expensive especially for the budget conscious travelers. Also, many food and drink specially exist specifically during Happy Hour from 4-8 at Cabo.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay at Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: JMJC
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to LV. Our 1st trip was our wedding anniversay it was fabulous. The hotel was clean and always has something to do. Comedy, bands, and great food. In the past we would go on the strip, this trip we stayed in the Palace Station 4 of the 6 days enjoying their entertainment. Our room was clean and I really liked the eco friendlyness. The two down sides one was the shuttle. The times have been cut back so you do have to plan if you want to go to strip, shopping or the airport. Second the pillows not the best by far, but comfortable bed for sure. We are looking to next year visit. May sneak a quick weekend in if airfare is affordable. Oh! the staff the best!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at great value....will come back !”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: nice hotel ,a bit off the strip but in overall for 75 us per day a great value.i upgraded to a tower suite with 50 '' tv and living room and was delighted. efficient and friendly mexican room maids, great and helpful staff (especially linda from the desk, very efficient!!) and clean and nice atmosphere.they have a shuttle to the srip and the airport which is helpful when u dont want to rent a car. very pleasant stay in a nice hotel. the pool area was kind of poor and not very big but it really doesnt matter. noisy tourists everywhere but this is not the hotel s fault.nice 1 dolar margaritas :) will be back in 2 months .thanks !

Reviews.Title: “bed bug bites”
Reviews.Author: balas2011
Reviews.Content: I was there with my wife for two night and almost three dayes.At first we thought room was clean but when we came back, I got bed bug bites, and it has been a week that I am itching my body. Any way I just want to tell you watch up....We where in room 2207.Siranoosh1020@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, I would rate it Four Stars”
Reviews.Author: Peggy P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Encore, Ventian, Palms, Caesars (penthouse) and others, I also stayed at the Sands in it's prime. It's a smaller hotel then the others, but what they have to offer, is CUSTOMER SERVICE and GOOD FOOD. The employees all have a smile and want to help (you do not have to look or wait for some one to come to help you). The food in all the Restaurants isoutstanding, there are a few of them and I have eaten at all. Their Cafe for beakfast is the best, the Oyster Bar has the best Clam Chowder makes you think you are in Maine and the Gumbo Oh, Oh. I do not have room to tell you about the others or go into deep detail. But If you are interested in a hotel that is not on the strip but give you the Strip acommodations, also give you more money to play the slots this is the place. Do not forget the outstanding CUSTOMER SERVICE, GO TO THE PALACE STATION.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: 51chucky
Reviews.Content: We all had a great three night stay. The only negative was the extra $50.30 for amenities we did'nt use.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Serivce not their forte, but food was GREAT at all venues”
Reviews.Author: Regina C
Reviews.Content: I would like to start by saying even though the service was not all that great, I would stay again, as the food at every single restaurant was great, both taste and pricing. I also appreciated the airport shuttle. This was my first stay at Palace station. It was for business from a Sunday to Sunday for a rather intense 6 day long certication course for work. I travel to Vegas about once a year, and have always been a die hard "downtown" hotel fan. I arrived with an associate from work (we are both women) both toting 2 large, heavy suitcases (books for our class). We walked past several valet and bell hops without receiving any offer of assistance. My room reservation was not ready, as we arrived early, but was assured that my room would be ready after 3pm. When I checked back after 3pm my suite had been given to another guest. I was told if I took a tower room for that evening, my suite would be "blocked off" and available the next day. When I check back with registration after my class was finished (7:30pm) the next evening, I was told by another employee that the one the night before "did not have the authority" to hold that room for me, as it was "reserved" for a "casino guest" due to arrive 2 days from then. She was "sorry" but they had no other smoking suites available. I had to insist for another 4-5 minutes that if they were not going to have a suite available, they should have advised me of that 6 weeks earlier when I made the initial reserviation. She disappeared behind a door labelled "VIP" reservation for a few minutes before she returned with a key to the infamous "blocked" suite.

Reviews.Title: “a re-union between dad and his daughters”
Reviews.Author: mariaelena m
Reviews.Content: As usual, the service was wonderful, everyone is helpful, we always hav a wonderful time, my children enjoy their stay specially the pool , We enjoy the casino and startbuck, is always good to have your favorite coffee. it would be helpful for shuttle bus to be closer to strip instead of the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!! Go for the Tower Pettite Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaked007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of a long trip to Nevada and Utah. The Luxury Pettite Suite was beautiful. It was roomy, clean and well appointed. We were facing the mountains and North Las Vegas. Very pretty. The staff was friendly and helpful. However, be warned that some of the "Non-Smoking" rooms have been heavily smoked in. Such was our first room, which was changed swiftly and efficiently within minutes. Food is very good at the Grand Cafe (Be sure to sample the excellent deserts!!) and at the very simple but very tasty Food Express Chinese restaurant. A very nice place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: gigi88t
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great place to stay. The rooms were nice, quiet away from the casino and the crowd. The pool was warm, enough. We swam at night. Loved the shuttle service. Everything we ate was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KDJ123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Fair enough is isnt on the strip, but it is excellent value for money, and a taxi over to the strip was only $15. It is much calmer than the hotels on the strip and is therefore easy to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck-are you kidding..totally gross”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Airlines put us here.. Going to file a minor complaint with Delta. ROOMS :dirty..smelly,dangerous, weird people hanging out in parking lot making noise & riding bicycles at 2AM, fights in the parking lot, dirty smelly linen. WORST PLACE I EVER STAYED AT. DESK STAFF RUDE. Run for the nearest exit for your own safety. NOT WORTH THE RISK OF STAYING THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: Kung_POW_Juju
Reviews.Content: I stay here pretty much every other year when I come for the annual flag football tournement. Can't go wrong with the affordalble prices, but recommend the updgrade. Closer to the hotel unless you on a tight budget and don't mind the extra walk.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at your Resort”
Reviews.Author: William S
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I combined a business and pleasure trip last month, we had a very pleasant experience. Our stay was only four short days. I have stayed at Palace Station many times in the past when in Las Vegas for business. This is the first time since the renovation of the tower rooms and I was very impressed with the new look. We prefer to stay off the strip and save our money for gambling and shows. We hope to return soon for business or pleasure. Thanks to all of your staff and the attention they paid to us. W.T. Selby

Reviews.Title: “How things have changed...”
Reviews.Author: nwtraveleror
Reviews.Content: Was in Las Vegas for the weekend. The location is extremely run down, but fits right in with Las Vegas (really shiny on the outside, but pretty gross when you look closely). The beds were disgusting and the whole casino reeks of decades of cigarette smoke. I room was pretty disgusting as well. Carpet was moldy, TV didn't work and walking from the casino to our room was similar to walking through a bad neighborhood at night. Won't be back. Was excited to find out that you could check into your flight from the lobby, but then disappointed when I learned that to use the computers in the business center, it costs 2.99/minute.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, clean bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: crm79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this hotel for him to attend a conference at the Caesar's Palace Hotel. Unfortunately, when he decided to book the trip, Caesar's Palace was booked and we decided to stay at Palace Sation. We stayed at the tower and not the courtyard. The crowed in this casino is trash and you don't really want to use the facilities. We basically stayed because the room and bathroom were clean and we spent the day at the strip. The hotel lobby smell like cigarretes, but the breakfast buffett was decent and affordable. Only use this hotel if you are just looking for a place to crash at night and enjoy fun and shows at the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: CB777
Reviews.Content: As usual, the Palace Station came through for me and 4 associates as we attended a convention recently at the MGM. The buffet can't be beat for the price, service and food quality! The service at the buffet deserves extra recognition and appreciation as they all worked very hard and anticipated my needs and even remembered my drink order from the day before! The luxury tower rooms are clean and updated and a fantastic value. I would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - the only place we ever stay”
Reviews.Author: negretej
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed 2 nights. We were totally surprised to find that when we checked in we were comped a huge suite. The room was beautiful. We travel to Vegas at least twice a year and only stay at the Palace Station. The Oyser Bar is a great place to eat - glad to see that it is now open 24 hours. We always get special offers in the mail to stay here. I am going to return Labor Day weekend, and was invited to participate in a slot machine tournament. Best place to sleep, eat and gamble!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bottom of the food chain”
Reviews.Author: hhsdrama
Reviews.Content: I reserved a non-refundable room many months in advance at a special rate. When we got to the hotel the front desk clerk said rooms with double beds were sold out. He said that he could give me a king bed and a rollaway bed. I had to take what they had. Rollaway bed was useless. The mattress was paper thin and you felt every wire in the frame. I chucked the frame and dragged the mattress into the BATHROOM and used it as my sleeping quarters for 2 days. Lesson learned: NEVER book a non-refundable room. You are at the bottom of the food chain. They can treat you like dirt and you are powerless because you already paid. You can't get your money back! It's not worth the extra few dollars you saved. Now, we stay at the Southpoint Casino. Far better and they treat your right! Never again will we stay at the Palace Station. They lost a customer for life.

Reviews.Title: “We love it. We stay at least once a year!"”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Davis
Reviews.Content: The Palace Station staff have always been helpful and friendly. The service is great. From the front desk to room service. The last few times we've stayed, I've made reservations on line and received some great deals. We got the mini suite at a sweet price. On our last visit there was a mix up on the room we were charged for vs the one we received. The staff at the front desk got it straightened out in little time and were very gracious about it. Our favorite place to eat at Palace Station: The Oyster Bar. Get there early if you want to avoid a long line (up to a 45 minute wait). However, the food is so delicious, it's well worth the wait. We go at least once every time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the extra bucks and stay on the strip..”
Reviews.Author: miabee
Reviews.Content: I took this trip to Vagas with several girlfriends for 3 nights..No complaints regarding the room and the shuttle to and from the airport was convenient. However - all of the staff that I encounter were the worst possible. Very unfriendly. Unless you stay in the Towers - there are no elevators. We arrived late in the evening and had to carry our luggage up 3 flight of stairs. No help was offered. Eyes were rolled with every question asked. I had better encounters with the staff of other hotels as I walked the strip. If you expect a friendly helpful staff at your hotel I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Aruiz816
Reviews.Content: Friendly front desk service, clean and roomy. Close to the strip without the strip traffic. Plasma tv and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place For Adults”
Reviews.Author: kiester98
Reviews.Content: This place is one of my favorite places to stay. Its renovated rooms are very comfortable, Gaming is great with bingo and blackjack. Great places to eat that are super affordable. If you are a person that wants to just get away and relax and not do much this is a great place. The pool areas are a little out dated but they will do. Tower rooms are the very best and you will not regret your nights there. Grand Cafe has a great selection of food and its open all night. I like to be away from the strip and this place is loved by locals. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jjcarroll4th
Reviews.Content: rooms by the pools are great. we love them, they are close to the casino and the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs and not worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: sraf06
Reviews.Content: We visit this hotel every time we are in Vegas (2-3 times a year) becasue of BINGO- I know- kind of silly, but the staff in the BINGO room are the best. We found an amazing rate on line but upon check-in there was a $16.95 "resort fee" we never knew about. That fee was almost as much as the room itself!! When we inquired why we were told it was for the shuttle to the airport and for the pool. Well, if you ever saw this "pool" you would realize it isn't really a pool at all!! The rooms were horrible with the world's loudest AC unit that kept us awake all night. In fact, the rooms were so small that one of the beds was touching the wall AC unit!! One of us froze and the other was sweating. Sadly, we will never stay here again. The total price we paid would have put us at a much nicer place. Shame on you Palace Station for this shameful hidden fee and a front desk staff that could care less.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure to book a Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: cookemaster
Reviews.Content: I booked our room online and did not realize the difference between a terrace and tower room. We booked a terrace room which was located just outside the casino in a separate building. The room we were given was ok, but it was located next to the casino recycling area of the casino. It was late when we arrived, around 11:30 and the was a lot of crashing and banging going on from the casino recycling center. I called to ask if it was going to go on all night and it stopped a few minutes later, but started again around 5am. We complained and were moved to a Tower Room, which was much larger and modern. However the casino is very convenient, with a great buffet and Starbucks located inside, and several other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and easy”
Reviews.Author: jessallison
Reviews.Content: Its a great place to stay if you want to have the hustle and bustle of the the strip at day, and a more relaxed atmosphere at night. Its off the strip so check in is easy, valet was great as well. Having Starbucks in the hotel certainly made las vegas mornings a lot easier. :)

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: m8it
Reviews.Content: Thank you for providing a safe, friendly and fun environment for me! I grew up in Vegas and visit often for family functions and business. I usually come to Vegas alone and I always feel welcome and safe at the Palace! I wanted to also mention Marco to you. He has been a great host who has always been there and gone out of his way many times to help our family over the years. My uncle has been staying at your establishment for many years, over thirty I believe. It's like our home away from home! I will continue to make the Palace Station my hotel choice when I visit Vegas as will my friends and family. Thanks again to your entire wonderful staff! C. Stephenson Colorado Springs, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms by the pool”
Reviews.Author: GabiLuna
Reviews.Content: unless you want to party all night, rooms by the pool in the courtyard section are loud.

Reviews.Title: “Overall decent place to stay - a bit offstrip”
Reviews.Author: domino007
Reviews.Content: My first trip to LV and I stayed here with my wife and 4-year old daughter - got a deal thru travel website for tower room ($45 per day) + resort fees (16$ per day !!!). However at check-in I realized that the room was on third floor and didnt have any good view at all. However it was non-smoking, very clean and had good space as well. I would have given higher rating but one of the reason was that the hotel didn't provide any drinking water in the room. When I called up the room service they informed that they will charge for the water. Its not very far from the strip but you need your own vehicle as the shuttle service is limited and the last shuttle operates at 11 PM. I didn't dine at the hotel at all and hence no comments on the food.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip and Lowsy”
Reviews.Author: xochitl
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel. We were given a room at the back, with no elevator and no services. We thought we were given a room with the hotel workers. Also got a surcharge of $17 per day, even though this was a package done with the purchaseof the airline ticket. Do not waste your time with this hotel, get one at the Strip and have fun. Lots of food at the buffet but below standard for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and eat”
Reviews.Author: sardross
Reviews.Content: The reception people were very helpful as soon as we started to talk to them. Nothing was too much trouble - all our requests were looked after and we had a room in the Tower. The room was big and the beds very comfortable with all you would want. We joined the casino club and that gave us cheaper buffet prices - $20 all day buffet - you can't beat that. The food was better than most buffets we had in Las Vegas and the cheese burger they freshly made was outstanding. It was only a 10 minute drive to the Strip and they also had a Shuttle if you need it. Nearby is a 7Eleven store and it is only a few minutes drive to China Town. The heated pool was excellent and the spa was great, all the people we met there could not fault anything. If we go back to Vegas - Palace Station is where we will be.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, But not great.”
Reviews.Author: Boise_IdahoMetfan
Reviews.Content: After reading all the glowing reviews of Palace Station, we booked a 3 night stay. Well, it was okay, but not great. The tower rooms were nicely redone and the bed was comfortable. The bath towels were very, very small and they only gave you one towel per person. The resort fee is a little high for what you get. They make you think you're getting all these great ammenities, but an average traveler wouldn't use half of them. It did cover the use of the WiFi, but only for one computer/IPOD, so if you have a spouse or kids that use it, you'll have to pay another fee. The advertise the great prices on they buffet, but that only applies if you have a players card. If you don't it's $5.00. Of course we didn't know this until we were already to pay. The cocktails waitstaff is a little rude and the gambling wasn't great. Check in was pretty slow, and there was a computer glitch one night shutting down the the portion of the slot machines that handle the tickets. You could play, but you had to use cash and you had to cash out your tickets before moving to another machine. On the plus side, the cafe food was great and the mexican restaurant is one of the best! Parking was easy and the location right by the 15 freeway can't be beat. I think the most irritating aspect is that Louie Anderson's picture is EVERYWHERE, even on the room keys. NOT a guy you want to be looking at everytime you turn around.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: nutravelsawait
Reviews.Content: Not on the strip, but thats no problem as the hotel offers free shuttle to and from. The casino is small but plenty to do. The rooms were clean and the staff was very help and courteous. Best of all - the buffet was awesome and the price was like no other!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Karin-and-Ton
Reviews.Content: You don't have to stay at the strip in Las Vegas, as this is a great place to stay. We went there twice during our holiday, first at the start and again at the finish of our holiday. We stayed in the hoteltower suites. On our return trip we got an upgrade for only $ 20 and were placed in one of the corner rooms high in the tower. Great to look out over the strip. If you want to go to the strip the hotel offers a free shuttle service! Also lots of options to eat in the hotel itself, especially the feast buffet is worthwhile. If you are a member (free) you get a discount on the meals, for example lunch $6.99.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Experience During a Difficult Time"”
Reviews.Author: retiredUtah
Reviews.Content: My youngest son slipped and fell off a mountain in Utah while rock climbing. He was airlifted to the UMC trauma unit in Las Vegas for treatment. My wife and I rushed to Las Vegas and contacted the Palace Station Hotel for accommodations. It was located only a few blocks from the hospital. We are so glad that we did! The hotel was wonderful! We had a lovely, very clean room, and the parking was in a covered lot with quick safe access. The hotel staff went out of their way to assist us in every way! The hotel found rooms for my son's visiters and friends at discounted rate. The front desk staff were so pleasant, professional and helpful. The Cafe was wonderful. Great food and service! We were so fortunate to have found such a wonderful safe place to stay near the hospital! Thank you to all the professional and dedicated staff, and to Palace Station Hotel and Casino were being such a fine caring neighbor to us! We'll never forget your kindness during this difficult time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkaplan271
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Palace Station in the Tower rooms. We found the hotel older but clean and the people were very nice. Our room in the Tower was just remolded and it had the nicest shower we have ever had in a hotel. We ate at the Oyster Bar in the hotel the food was wonderful!! Great value for the money and it fun to watch them prepare it in front of you. Our kids stayed in the courtyard rooms and we found it looking very worn but it was still clean and the bath was remolded. We would stay here again if ever looking for an alternative to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A great casino & hotel that still believes customer service is the key”
Reviews.Author: Ozinvegas
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for Las Vegas Disneyland, this may not be the place for you but if you care about great service, polite staff, better gambling odds than the Strip, and value for your hard earned money, you can't beat Palace Station or any of the Station casinos really. Even though I'm not a high-roller, I have received personal service from my casino host Janet (she's the best!) and have even had nice gift baskets waiting for me upon arrival. For the Super Bowl party, she even came to the slot machine I was playing at to make sure I knew where to go and what time to check in. I enquired about Super Bowl parties with some of the Sam Boyd casinos and they didn't even bother to reply (You hear that Gold Coast & California Casino?). You tell ME why a lot of my Vegas money is going to the Station Casinos instead of the Boyd or Harrah's chains? SERVICE people. Everyone is giving comps these days but SERVICE is hard to find. Thank you Palace Station.

Reviews.Title: “Decent casino and hotel - shady neighborhood surrounding this place”
Reviews.Author: bugaloo68
Reviews.Content: Overall, not a bad place to stay. Ask for a tower room. These rooms are very nice. The hotel is an older one, with decent rooms in the tower section. My only complaints about my tower room were the pillows (VERY thin) and the shower. The pillows were so thin, I had to stack 3 of them to get any sort of support. You may want to bring your own pillows if you like any sort of head support during sleep. My other complaint about the room was the shower. I laughed, because normally people complain about the lack of pressure and lack of hot water. My complaint was the excessive pressure (felt like scalding hot needles being shot at me) and the extremely how water from the shower head. I actually had to run the water for about 5 minutes to allow it to be cool enough for me to stand under the shower. God help anyone with a sunburn! The room was fairly clean and houskeeping was very accomodating. Cigarette smoke was not an issue in my 10th story room, nor was casino noise, although, I would imagine anyone with a "courtyard" room would have suffered from both smoke and noise from the casino. BEWARE OF THE RESORT FEE! This place charged me $17 per night for "complimentary" things such as free wi-fi (available only downstairs and not in rooms), shuttle to the airport/Strip locations, use of the swimming pool and fitness room, local phone calls from the room, daily local newspapers, etc. It seems to me that if such things are truly complimentary, one should not be paying for them. I drove my own vehicle and did not need shuttles anywhere, have a smart phone (with internet, local, and long distance calling capability, as well as getting news) and did not need or use free wi-fi, did not use the small/cold swimming pool (which a young boy jumped out of and urinated next to it as his adult family members watched), and did not use the small/inadequate fitness room. I have stayed in nicer and newer casinos (Southpoint, Suncoast, etc) and didn't pay nearly as high a resort fee for "complimentary" services. On a positive note, the parking areas were dilligently patrolled by armed security guards, and I felt my vehicle was relatively safe from people breaking into it. The casino was not bad. This is considered a "locals" casino, and consequently, some, shall I say, INTERESTING, people were there. The slots were very stingy, although I actually came out ahead by about $50. (I play slots for entertainment, not necessarily to win.) I was able to play $100 for about 8 hours during the course of my stay (about 3 hours a day for the 4 days I was there). Cocktail waitresses seemed to be pretty good about making their rounds while I gambled. Be forewarned - the casino floor is poorly ventilated and cigarette smoke was quite thick. I am not a smoker and during my meals inside the casino, I tasted/smelled the smoke while eating. There is an excellent pasta eatery inside the casino, as well as several other decent/reasonably priced establishments. I did not have any children with me, although I saw many kids, ranging from toddlers to teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “"We're Coming Back!"”
Reviews.Author: TeresaY4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times in the past and have only had a problem on check out once. All other times have been great. One of the things I love about Palace Station is the Oyster Bar, the food rocks. My husband and I will drive the 4 hours just to eat at the Oyster Bar. The service has been great as well as the Tower Rooms. Word of advice, the Courtyard rooms are less expensive but not worth the price, pay the little more and get a tower room you won't regret it. I am coming back in July for more fun at bargain prices. Teresa Y.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the value - locals love the casino”
Reviews.Author: Webb2001
Reviews.Content: The Palace Station is one of the "local" casinos that understands the value of allowing players in the casino to win once in awhile so they can enjoy their gaming experience. It is a friendly place with a wonderful staff. The hotel is above average - if you stay in the tower rooms. The courtyard rooms are good, but a bit too small for my pleasure. For the money, there is still no better buffet in town than this one at Palace Station .

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: bingomama73
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself were always staying at the hotels on the strip. Now we are loyal to the Palace Station.Why you ask we are treated with the up most respect and the hospitality is wonderful.We are loyal bingo players and the bingo clerks are the greatest.They make us feel like we are at home and we have known them for years.Now are casino host Lisa Wells she is amazing there is times when we decide at the last minute to go to Vegas and she always gets us the best rooms and and when we get into town always greets us and make sure we have every thing we need.The rooms are clean,and the food is great We will never stay anywhere esle now but the Palace Station Try it and i am sure you will feel the same Good luck

Reviews.Title: “We shall return”
Reviews.Author: dianneonly
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palace several times and have always enjoyed ourselves. They have great food. Wonderful games. There roomes have a lot of space and comfortable beds. The employees are friendly and accomodating. i can't say enough about the Palace. I will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 days at Palace Station”
Reviews.Author: wyandotte71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palace Station June 1-4, 2011. Always a satisfied customer and will continue to stay here. This is a nice off the strip hotel casino with free shuttle service to and from the airport and to the Fashion Show Mall too if you need/want to venture. No high cab fares for me! My husband and self stayed in the tower rooms, always clean and comfortable, no funny smells and room bug free. Decor is fresh and new and as nice as some of the more expensive places on the strip too! Really! We enjoyed the casino including poker, bingo and lots of slots. They also have a slot tournament on Wednesdays for people 50+ so that was unexpected and fun to try. Nice variety of table games as well as slots, including some of the newer machines. So glad they brought the Grand Cafe back and ate there quite a bit and always good, filling and reasonably priced. We took the shuttle to see the Beatles Love show at the Mirage and no problem with catching the shuttle to or from and sure beat not having to take a cab with crazy fare and crazy driving. Also spent one morning at 1 of 2 pools and enjoyed that. They are smaller pools and more comforatble IMO than the larger hotels as this did not have that overcrowded feeling.I felt comfortable and safe at the Palace Station, never have had a problem. There parking is ample and well lit which is alot more than I can say for some of the big casinos and much more convenient too! I would rate my visit 5 star and will continue to return to Palace Station every visit I make to Las Vegas! Keep up the good work Palace Station!

Reviews.Title: “What a SPECIAL experience!”
Reviews.Author: marinejwt
Reviews.Content: The best kept secret in Las Vegas! The rooms are VERY nice, and the service in ALL areas is professional with your comfort in mind. You are NOT on the "strip," but that's a GOOD thing... no traffic in and around the hotel... peaceful environment. Nice pools (yes, more than one) and elegant restaurants (several) all on the property. Make this your next vacation and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed the experience and will be back”
Reviews.Author: estepp
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed my stays at the Palace Station during the past several years. I have always been welcomed with a freindly greeting and treated as a valuable guest. The rooms are great values and if you like to gamble there is most everything there you would want to do so you would not have to go to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A respite from the chaos of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DaveyChuck
Reviews.Content: Right on the other side of the Strip you'll find this enormous casino hotel favored by locals. It's low on glamour, but high on value. It's the kind of place for people who are a little afraid of too much excitement! The restaurants are not bad and the casino is huge and loose! It's relatively sedate, but the insanity of the Strip is a quick cab ride away. Ideally, you should only stay here if you have a car since public transportation is very iffy in this part of town except for taxis. If you're lucky enough to get a Strip-facing room, you will have a fabulous view!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: Tchamp1221
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our Luxury Tower room and was suprised on how nice it was. I had read several reviews about the hotel prior to our stay and was hesitant about staying here. The service that we received during our stay was great. If you do decide to stay here just know that it is quite ways from the strip and you have to take the shuttle to get to an from the strip. We didnt mind the shuttle; and even apperciated the fact that it picked us up and dropped us off at the airport. So hopefully this post will help you decide. If you choose to stay here make sure you get the Luxury Tower room, they are much nicer than the courtyard room. Its a little bit more but definately worth it. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, economical and pleasant....”
Reviews.Author: Canuck1285
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel so I could attend a week long conference. We stayed in the Tower rooms...which is a must as the courtyard rooms are a little suspect. The Strip is easily accessible by either the hotel shuttle or 'The Duece' bus stop right out front of the hotel....we ate at several of the restaurants and found the food decent for what you paid. We live in Canada and have travelled in Europe and the Caribbean. We found this place comfortable enough that we would return and it is just far enough away from The Strip that there aren't all the annoying drunks to deal with. Saw plenty of families, but I'm not sure that this hotel caters to the family with kids under 10.,,,however everything is a bus ride away.

Reviews.Title: “A Smaller Casino with good games, tables and dining.”
Reviews.Author: JayneSchweiger
Reviews.Content: The staff are friendly and courteous, the table dealers are also very friendly and helpful. The restaurants were good, especially the Oyster Bar. The casino is smaller and not as glitzy as some on the strip, but the smaller atmosphere is nicer. The crowd is a more mature crowd, not a lot of family things to do at this casino. It is located way off the strip, but they shuttle you there and back several times during the day. Also a free shuttle to and from the airport. We always stay here when we come to Vegas, the price is good and the amenities are nice. No coffee makers in the room though.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute joke , completely nasty and dirty .”
Reviews.Author: Tinaschultzz
Reviews.Content: not only is it out of the way, you're pretty much secluded. but the rooms are nasty and filthy. The rooms definitely are not clean between customers. pretty sure all they do is get new towels and make the bed. the carpet stained the bedding old man gross . the first room we have the pleasure of walking into, smelt like a septic system with backing up. we called down to the front desk to switch they acted like it was a hassle to switch rooms and would not even come down to give us a new key. our room hat hair all over the shower. you could definitely tell that it had not been cleaned. we went down for my brothers wedding let me tell you what a nightmare please do not waste your time or money ..

Reviews.Title: “Rest, relax and re-invest in enjoyment!”
Reviews.Author: angelmusic46
Reviews.Content: Being a solo, female traveler, I look for safety and convenience. Palace Station excelled my expectations. It's location provided easy exit and entrance to the highway, while avoiding the noise of traffic. My smoke-free room was located in the beautifully acquitted tower, with convenient access to the casino and restaurants. The convenience of free wireless service was especially appreciated. I recommend the Feast Buffet, served at a discount for those with a Station Membership Card (free).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay a the Palace Station.”
Reviews.Author: awnmyown
Reviews.Content: My trip to Las Vegas was for a seminar, which was held at the Palace Station over the weekend, was very enjoyable and convienent. The hotel and facilities were so accomodating that other than my little run to Popcorn Girl; there was no need to leave the property. The resturants were top notch, the Oyster Bar was a must do experience and the gift shops priceses were very reasonable . The staff was very pleasant and helpful, everything was clean and inviting. Didn't care for all of the smoke smell, but did not know of a smoke free area to take refuge, so I toughed it out. I would return and refer to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, nasty nightmare! Run away as fast as you can!”
Reviews.Author: BeTheBestMe
Reviews.Content: I walked into my Courtyard room to find a maxi pad stuck to the wall, it was removed by housekeeping. I pulled back the bed covers to find hair in my bed and asked for a new room. I was upgraded to a very dirty suite with a toilet that had been used and not flushed, complete with pubic hair on the toilet seat. The bellman came and delivered my new keys but didn't even offer to help me move my bags. The room was right next to the freeway and every corner of the room was dirty. There were large holes in carpeting and the old coffee table was dirty with cup rings. It was very unsanitary, there was hair in the shower, i don't think either room had been cleaned. I was there for a conference and did not have time to change hotels until after lunch. I was a speaker at this conference and got no sleep, it really adversely effected my talk. Though I pressed for and was told I was getting a full refund, I did not. Run away as fast as you can! There are photos of how bad it is on my Facebook and I will be posting another YouTube video about the experience as well. Save your money and stay as far away from this place as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Buffet...free or not”
Reviews.Author: MarineT
Reviews.Content: Everything was very nice, all the other eating places were nice, me and my love ate only in 3 of the 6 places to eat at the Palace Station. Everything was clean and nice, service people were friendly and helpful, Casino was nice, the staff friendly even if you didn't sit at their table, they said hello, or good morning they even had $2 blackjack table. They had lot of different slot machines, the bingo room was very nice, free coffee and donuts in the morning. So what am I going write about?...I and my love go to 6 or 7 hotel/casinos a year with our senior group. Between the 2 of us we gamble $300 to $700 on a 3 day trip. Hotels always comp our group with free meals or meals included in the overall package and other perks. This was our first trip to Palace Station, we have been to the Boulder and Sunset station also very nice. We were comp 3 meals each at the buffet. The food was the most poorly prepared food outside of a homeless shelter and I have eaten in a homeless shelter as a guest. I said to my partner "must be a off day in the kitchen" only the salad area was nice with a good variety and dressings tasty. Everything was dry or too wet, tasteless or hard to chew. The cake or pies in the dessert area were dry or soggy. I could name at least 10 items or more not made or prepared properly. peas, beets , mash pototoes, rice, corn.. turkey and beef which were hand cut were chewy or dry. We left and 2 hours later we went to the Grand Cafe, where we had very nice sandwichs and fries with coffee that was served in pots left at the table, the prices were reasonable. The next day we had breakfast at Grand Cafe, it was very good and a special price that was reasonable, and the coffee pots service was reasonable, that maybe because there is a Starbucks on site. We had 4 comp tickets left, so we went back to the buffet for lunch the next day. A big disappointment...the kitchen was having 2 bad days. We did not use our last of the free comp tickets, a first for us. I know there are folks who will say I'm too picky...yes..if you are a heavy smoker or type who has never met a free meal they didn't like...the buffet will be OK. ..for rest of us Skip the Buffet..free or not.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and cockroaches...”
Reviews.Author: douglasalan63
Reviews.Content: Management acts like you should praise them. The bell desk is rude to the point that its uncomfortable...you want to leave. Sales Manager is a sloppy pig...hits on customers while getting drunk in the bar. When I complained about the bed bugs and cockroaches they basically said I was making it up...I suppose to cover up what a fraud everyone is there. Don't waste your time or money! They will overcharge you too!

Reviews.Title: “Happy”
Reviews.Author: Manny2365
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy with Palace Station Hotel, is nice place and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: ““Excellent Casino Hotel, off the Strip””
Reviews.Author: Anyta100
Reviews.Content: Excellent accomodations that exceeded all my expectations. My room was great, room service was nice and food was fresh, but best of all the staff were very friendly and gave 110% to make sure I was happy. And I was VERY happy! I would definitely recommend Palace Station Casino Hotel as a great bargain for those of you who are use to quality accomodations, and great for those of you tired of hotels on the strip. Worth every penny...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: UKINMX
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 nights, took advantage of all the food and drink promotions, used the pool (small, but clean, comfortable, and quite empty, even though it was Easter week), bought cheap tickets for a show at their ticket desk. The bathroom was beautiful, the rooms spacious and clean, the staff friendly. Though it is not on the strip, their shuttle service was always on time and comfortable (also to and from the airport). Hi-speed internet not free, but the free "slow" connection in the room was good enough. I didn't take a picture of the prime rib dinner at their Cafe, but I can tell you, it was worth it (all four of us had it several nights).

Reviews.Title: “Vegas trip to get married”
Reviews.Author: Ldiablo
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I have not been to Las Vegas for some time now and my then Girlfriend now wife has never been. I had planned everything about a month and a half before and didn't let her know until a day before. I bent over backwards to make this trip unforgettable. She loved the trip down to the Palace Station being beautiful, quiet and very friendly. Having spent some time on the strip really makes you appreciate the off strip peace and quiet that we get from the Palace Station. What a fantastic hotel with so many things to do and see under one roof. We didn't even take advantage of all the amenities offered. Thank you for such a wonderful experence.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Kaytimms
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Palace Station over the Easter long weekend and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Even though this hotel is off the strip, I liked the location. The shuttle bus was very convenient to use and it ran throughout the day. The rooms were nice, we stayed in the tower rooms, I recommend paying the extra and upgrading. The pillows were really nice. The bathroom was very nice as well, although the shower head was kind of weak, nothing a few extra minutes in the shower couldn't fix. We ate at the grande cafe twice and the pasta palace once. The breakfast skillets at the grande cafe were awesome an for $5 you can't go wrong. All in all, this under appreciated hotel is a diamond in the rough. I will stay there again when I return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than the Palace Station!”
Reviews.Author: 1harleyguy2
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay online and saved money! I had an enclosed trailer with a Harley Davidson Motorcycle inside. Spoke with the Security Team and they told me to coordinate with Valet once I arrived to park my trailer in the overflow valet parking lot. I arrived at 10:30 PM and valet instructed me on what to do. Got it done with no problems. I have a property in Las Vegas that I lease out so I come to the Las Vegas area several times a year. The Palace Station is off the strip, not a whole lot of traffic that you would normally see on the strip, which makes it a more comfortable setting for me and my wife. The Cabo Mexican Resturant was also superb as usual. Great service, great food served in a very timely manner. Slots were loose and won a little money. The Feast Buffet was great for a good breakfast, lots of items to choose from and fresh selection to choose from. My Tower Room was on the 11th floor with a spectacular view! To me it was just like a mini-suite, very spacious and loved the bed and TV! The casino comped me $15 for slot play and also a mailer was sent to me for a free Meal at the Feast Buffet. If your considering staying any where in Vegas take it from me the Palace Station "has it right" from the moment you arrive until you leave! I have stayed at other major hotels in Vegas but I would be hard pressed to find a great deal, great atmosphere, great food, great drinks to compliment a dinner and last but not least win at the slot machines!

Reviews.Title: “Defacto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerryMLeake
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palace Station many times over the last few years. On this visit, I noticed that they have remodeled the rooms in the Luxury Tower, and I couldn't be more pleased. Because I get to Vegas every few months or so, I've visited nearly every hotel on the strip, but with all the hustle and bustle on the strip, it's gets tiring. Staying at the Palace Station is close enough to the strip to enjoy the action, but far enough away to feel relaxed and like a local.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: redtail444
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel to stay in. It's off the main strip so it's more laid back, which I liked. The shuttle to the strip was great! It was much easier than having to deal with driving in downtown LV. The only problem was that the last shuttle was at 11:15pm, so we couldn't see a late show without missing our shuttle. The non-smoking room was clean, but still smelled somewhat of smoke. I don't know if it's possible to totally get away from cigarette smoke in LV though.

Reviews.Title: “you pay a budget price and that’s what you get”
Reviews.Author: Gotogofishing
Reviews.Content: Where do I start well I stayed at Palace Station whilst tripping overnight through Vegas hmmm will never stay again one night was enough. Room smelt, carpet was dirty you pay a budget price and that’s what you get (sometimes you can strike a winner and sometimes not). IMHO the poor reviews are justified and I shall not waste any more of my time other to say that I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time... Won Some Money!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo94
Reviews.Content: Palace Station is one of a group of "locals" casinos located just off the west side of the "Strip" on Sahara. They recently remodeled their Tower rooms, and they are very nice to stay in. I personally like the "locals" casinos because I feel the odds of winning are better (if you want to keep your local customers coming back, give them a fighting chance!). Station Casinos, which owns Palace Station, also has a great Player's Club program, which rewards you with free rooms, food, slot tournaments, entertainment, etc. One "must do" experience in Palace Station is eating at their Oyster Bar, located right in the middle of the casino. They use the freshest ingredients, and the menu is extensive and delicious! Their many other restaurants are satisfying as well, but my all-time favorite is the Oyster Bar. The casino is top notch, with many of the newest and most popular machines (locals, remember?). I won a $2,000.00 video poker jackpot this last trip, which made me very happy! I later saw a gentlemen playing a "China Mystery" penny machine get a $6,910.00 jackpot (rain on my parade!!). I can't figure out how he won that much, but I will be trying to figure it out during my next visit there (June slot tournament). Overall, nice rooms at a decent price, great restaurants and plenty of different casino options make Palace Station one of my favorite Las Vegas destinations. An added bonus is free shuttle service to and from both the airport and the "Strip".

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: bigrgdadd7
Reviews.Content: The lunch at the Oyster Bar was a great way to start our stay with good food. We were able to do good at the Black Jack tables in the afternoon and evening. Dinner at the Broiler was a great experance with good food and excelant service. Great rate on the room that had a nice big tub to soak in and a nice big flat screen TV to watch.

Reviews.Title: “A very Intimate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: engtechbob
Reviews.Content: The Palace Station is the easiest hotel to get to. Parking is easy and secure, the staff are all willing to help and make my stay pleasant. The casino is easy to navigate, and gambling usually pays off for me. All the food places in the hotel serve good food for a good value. I like the intimate atmosphere of the hotel and casino and I recommend it to all my friends and family.
