Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A GREAT TIME AND REALLY ENJOYED OUR STAY AT PALACE STATION.”
Reviews.Author: ZIPLUCYK
Reviews.Content: We really wish that coffee makers were in every room,so that we did not have to call housekeeping for the service, and each time we needed refills. We have stayed at the palace station about five times now and enjoyed every stay.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not the swanky 5 star like the Bellagio, but you will love it!”
Reviews.Author: luvdavy
Reviews.Content: I've been going to the Palace Station for about 6 years now, and often go alone, a middle-aged female. They treat me like royalty and I feel so safe that I do not hesitate to be in the casino or coming and going in the wee hours. The regular rooms in the tower are very nice and quite adequate for 2 people. They have a bit larger suites as well that are extremely nice. The slots and poker machines seem to be looser than most, and they cater to locals. If you want to sit by the pools (2 gorgeous pools and jacuzzi's!) you don't feel embarassed to walk through the casino to the elevator. And you don't have to look like a movie star to be comfortable, either. They have about 6 excellent restaurants, including one that is open 24 hours. One is a high-end steak and lobster restaurant, one is an oyster bar, one a Chinese, one for pasta, and one Mexican. And then there is the FEAST...for $5 buffet breakfasts that can't be equalled or $9 buffet dinners that those on a budget will enjoy. They have a nice gift shop, a beauty salon on premises, and a fitness room, as well as a free shuttle bus to the local Fashion Mall all during the day and evening. They will pick you up and take you back to the airport as well. If you want an excellent value luxury vacation at a casino, and don't care to live like the rich and famous, the Palace Station is perfect for you. I love staying there and feel like they are old friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation because of the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: suzyq65567
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent vacation because of the hotel. I have severe food and environmental allergies. The hotel was non-smoking, the room was wonderfully clean. I really enjoyed the time we were in Vegas. It was nice to have a place that was so friendly and helpful. The staff we encountered was wonderful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Meeshie21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas many times, this is our new favorite place to stay!! The restaurants we have tried (Oyster Bar, Pasta Palace and Grand Cafe) are fantastic and the staff really goes that extra mile to make you feel welcome. The Pasta Palace was especially an unexpected delight. The rooms are spacious and comfortable with beautiful views. The proximatey is convenient to the strip and downtown. There is plenty of free parking if you rent a car or a shuttle if you don't. We have trips planned for May and August and this is where we will be staying....

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: same_jeans
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a room to stay in whilst visiting Vegas, this hotel does the trick. If you're looking for a luxury holiday, you'll need to be prepared to pay a lot more. We stayed in the courtyard (the cheapest part). Rooms are clean, have basic facilities and very spacious. However, you wouldn't want to be spending your days in the room as it would get a bit depressing. Facilities are a bit basic for vegas, but more extensive than lots of other places we've stayed at elsewhere. They ahve several on-site restaurants which served good food at reasonable prices. They have a couple of small pools and, obviously, the casino. Would definitely stay again for a budget holiday, but this isn't a luxury venue.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Honest”
Reviews.Author: mpcollins777
Reviews.Content: I left my new digital camera in the foray near the check-in lobby desk. I was scheduled to to be married at 5:30PM across town. When I realized my camera was left behind, we call the front desk, who contacted the hotel security and to my great surprise, had it in their possession. But wait, they went one more step. They had an employee bring the camera to my wedding chapel in their hotel limo. Now that was cool!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: ricotio
Reviews.Content: check in staff was friendly and very helpful.also for the location its only a mile away from strip just catch suttle you are there. rooms are clean and very nice decore. casino is win and win. i personally rather stay here than on the strip for the value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: LindafromIdaho
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and always notice workers cleaning everywhere inside and outside the building. I feel very safe and secure during my stay. The staff is great and the restaurants serve good food. The Oyster Bar is my favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service. Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: mweidmanrn
Reviews.Content: Checked in Sunday afternoon. Only 2 people on staff at desk. Long wait. Our first room in the tower hadn't been cleaned by housekeeping, (dirty bed, trash, towels on floor). A bellman brought us keycards to a new room and we got settled in. That night we were woken up by the couple next door fighting, (Slamming doors, F*** this,F*** you). Called the desk and asked for security. This helped for short periods of time but never lasted. Went to the desk in the AM and asked for a different room and was told we could get one on a lower floor. Why didn't we call security last night? No appology, offer of a bellman to help move etc. We then deceided to cut our losses and check out even though the room was prepaid for three nights. When we told a different desk clerk this we were finally upgraded to a Jr Suite. Too many problems and too poor of service. Should be called Redneck Station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but stay in the tower rooms.”
Reviews.Author: candelite
Reviews.Content: Call ahead for the free hotel shuttle schedules from the airport, as when I arrived it was a bit problematic, due to a 2 hour break in the schedule, which resulted in me having to find alternative transportation. The hotel was nice, clean and well-kept, but the courtyard rooms are a bit noisy... so stay in the tower rooms unless you don't mind a boisterous atmosphere. Charge everything to your room, gamble in the loose-slot casino, and ask for a casino host at least mid-way through your visit. The goodies the host can give you will make your visit even more worthwhile! I just wish there were not additional fees (about $16 per night) not included in the package.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: DonKClovis
Reviews.Content: Palace Station Hotel and Casino fit the needs for my business trip. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bossman66441
Reviews.Content: we booked a king bed room in advance in the tower, when we got there they tried to give us a room with double beds so we complained and they gave us a king suite room other than that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from beginning to end with an upgrade to a suite!! Thanks.”
Reviews.Author: mimidenden
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were greeted by a gentleman at the desk who was all smiles vs the Riviera's new and unfriendly "automated check-in" (older people who are not computer users will hate this). We were sent to a courtyard room which was at the very end next to the outer door entrance. A very busy area with a bus load of people who just arrived. We went back to the front desk to request another room. That same gentleman at the desk moved us up to a suite for a small fee. So worth it.... Needless to say we had a ball. We actually stayed in our room for a few cocktails while thoroughly enjoying the room. The restaurants were fantastic as always. The oyster bar is the best thing going in Las Vegas bar-none and their buffet is always great. The problem of "All the food tastes the same" doest NOT apply to this buffet. Year after year I get the same table and I still have the same man who gets us our beverages. I like that they "keep" their staff. It's nice to see familiar faces year after year. RIP Maryanne, who was one of their best dealers. You are still missed. I'm not much for the hustle and bustle of the strip with all the mobs of people. So just a quick ride down Sahara ave, and the stress of the strip is GONE. Palace Station gets two thumbs up with us.

Reviews.Title: “Great place just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: HBFlorida
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Palace Station as a stopping off place when we were traveling further south in Nevada. We had a late check-in (almost midnight) and were treated as if we were royalty. We were given upgraded accomodations so my sister with a heart condition wouldn't have to deal with stairs. We were given complementary breakfasts which we were able to use immediately in the cafe (and we were so hungry when we got off of the plane is was a welcome to our stomachs). Our room was clean, the beds more than comfortable and the temperature of the rooms easily adjustable. The casino staff was as equally kind and considerate as the front desk. My sister and I were winding down from our travels at a slot machine and a young attendant noticed we weren't playing with player cards. He stopped what he was doing and went and got us player cards so we could earn casino incentives. Our check out was as smooth as the check in. We had different faces on the desk, but the same kind, considerate attitudes. The hotel offers shuttle service to the airport (which I have used on previous visits) as well as to the strip. If you want a great hotel without the hustle and bustle of the strip, but still are close enough to do all the things you want on the strip, Palace Station is the place to go. Great service, convenient and so cost efficient why would you go anywhere else. We will always book at Palace Station when we come to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet to die from”
Reviews.Author: johnatsis
Reviews.Content: There's no good way to say it - The Palace Station Feast Buffet is bad - I have been to lot's of other Vegas buffets and this one is the worst. - The other Station Casino's Green Valley, Red Rock have great food - go figure

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable”
Reviews.Author: rosebatonrouge
Reviews.Content: how can someone send you to a back alley for your room where you had to make sure that the derelicts hanging around were gone before you walked across. then you had to walk a mile to find your room which noone seemed to know where it was at. you enter the room and the smell of mustiness and mold hits you and now we are sick so you say well you know we didn't have to pay much but when you lie down the springs stick through the mattress into your back there is no way to sleep bathroom no vanity and a shower where the water gets all over the floor and service well they don't do anything without you calling and finally did get the few towels they give you why would these not be condemned i mean i can touch the ceiling and heard all the noise in the walls these are the type of motels where you see on the bad side of town for "you know what"

Reviews.Title: “Stank Nasty Motel= The "Courtyard"”
Reviews.Author: cobrien7225
Reviews.Content: If courtyard means the back ally of the hotel then yes, we stayed in the "courtyard". This is the most disgusting experience I have ever had in a hotel. We got our package off of expedia,com and yes while it was cheap, the pictures were so deceiving. The courtyard is not a part of the palace station casino and hotel. It is a roach motel behind the hotel. Where were the pictures of that posted on their website??? Yes, it was cheap but if i had known this is where they were going to sentence us to, I would have booked another hotel and paid double what we paid to stay in this trash bucket. The room had an offensive stench every time we walked in. It smelled like smoke and mold. The air conditioner sucked, it was either too freezing or burning up. The bed was nothing more than a box of springs. The most uncomfortable bed I have ever laid on. I couldn't sleep at all. They charged a service fee and for what??? we had to call guest services at 4 in the afternoon because our room was not cleaned, bed not made and no towels restocked. This place is the sickest of the sick and i will NEVER EVER BE BACK>

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price - updated rooms. NEED a car, though.”
Reviews.Author: kipwingerjr
Reviews.Content: I read almost every review before staying here. Yes, from what I could tell, the courtyard rooms would NOT be recommended unless you really needed a cheap stay. We booked through a package (expedia), and got this hotel for an unreal, absolutely unbelievably cheap price for the courtyard rooms. When we arrived, I asked about the rooms and upgrades. We were moved to a tower room (2 queens) for $20 extra a night. IMO, very much worth it. Large bathroom, nice amenities, huge flat screen, comfy beds, and great view. Stayed on the 18th floor. The room was worth the price. (PLEASE know almost every hotel charges a resort fee now. We used the internet here and it worked well). The location is off the strip. We had a rental car, so this posed absolutely no problem. The shuttle seemed to run often for those without a car. I recommend everyone get a rental, though. Las Vegas is SO MUCH MORE than the strip - exploring it all in a car is excellent. Food nearby (in a car, that is) is excellent. Red Rock Canyon is close, as well, and is a sight to behold. Service here was 4 star. Almost every person at the PS was extremely friendly. This is one of the RARE hotels where housekeeping ALWAYS respected the privacy sign and did not knock in the morning to clean. When the did clean, we had refills of everything we needed and they respected our belongings. At the cafe and the Oyster bar (great food both places in our 2 visits) the employees were very friendly and helpful. A hint to everyone - go to the pool and get some of the EXCELLENT towels (the standard towels are only so-so). Also, we had an A/C that was temperamental, but we never reported it because it wasn't that bad. I did let them know at checkout, however, and they were apologetic. Overall, I would stay here again if I got an EXCELLENT rate AND had a rental car. If you stay here, you should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The room on the website looks WAY better!”
Reviews.Author: redeemed2011
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again! My husband and I were very disappointed with how old the room looked. It looks so nice on the website, but when we got there, we were taken to the back, which was a DUMP!! The ONLY nice part of our room was the bathroom, yeah well, we couldn't sleep in there! NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “What happened, used to be better?”
Reviews.Author: geekor
Reviews.Content: Ok so this wasn't out first time staying here. Our past time though we spent very little time in the hotel itself, as we go to Vegas to visit family. But this trip was different, and boy I don't want to spend that much time in this type of hotel again. There was good and bad, but the bad just rubbed me the wrong way. The Room: Clean, no frills, but decent room. Beds in our room were too old and lumpy however. Being there for 4 nights was much too much and both me and my wife's back were not happy after our time there. The chairs were just as uncomfortable. Our TV had continuous issues turning off by itself, maintenance would take over 2 hours to come, not fix the issue, and never come back, even AFTER saying they would be back soon to check up on it. Our 2nd day came back to a horrible smoke smell (non-smoking room, middle of 3 straight non-smoking floors) in the room. Was told there was nothing they could do unless we left the room for an hour? at 9 pm with a sleeping kid? Instead me wife kept her sleeve up at her face all night long.... not pleasant. The Food: The Grand Cafe has decent food. In 4 meals, 3 were very good, one was not good. We got their Prime Rib twice, but one time the meat was flavorless and tough, the 2nd was flavorful and tender. But when ordering food togo, the host/cashier was rude and even though I was sitting right there waiting, I had to ask for my food (they said 15 min, asked after 25) and it was there at the counter, but she never told me. Maid Service: We only got it once, and they did not replace cups or give us enough towels that we had to call and ask for more. Not good. Getting no help with a broken TV and smoke smelling room killed our experience here. I don't think the service here is good, and they don't seem to care that they amke you unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravel11
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay here at Palace station. Its located off the strip. But has lot of facilities . Buffet is cheapp and good. My kid also enjoyed the stay . We got microwave and other extra things at nominal costs. . Starbucks was inside and few other restaurants are nearby .

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ShaarWI
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the Vegas strip, but still one of the nicest to stay at with large and comfortable rooms. (I have only stayed in the tower) The Valet service is quick and efficient if you have a vehicle, if not Palace Station offers shuttle service to the strip and airport. The Casino is large with many areas and types of machines along with black jack and other casino games. There are several restuarant choices where you may use your comps. I have stayed here many times over the years, the first back in the 1990's, it has been well maintained over the years. Always one of my top choices to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “be very careful, their slick.”
Reviews.Author: eddlt
Reviews.Content: found great price of $160 for five nights over weekend. at check-in the girl said sign here, here, and here. I did and at checkout 3am they added $83 for hotel fees that they said were on the web site. If I had seen that I would have stayed at a more convenient hotel for less. All i'm saying is be very careful!!!! Stayed here many times before, but never again. Was with my son and we gambled above average amounts. The next casino will benefit from this fiasco.

Reviews.Title: “I look forward to visiting the Palace Station, soon..”
Reviews.Author: jspino
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed myself everytime i visited this casino. One of the best casinos i have been, interms of selection. Reasonable hotel rates. And for me, his payouts..

Reviews.Title: “nice place to relaxed for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: cd400ruco56
Reviews.Content: it was a nice comfortable room and the hotel location was nice and quiet, away from all the Las Vegas traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Family”
Reviews.Author: babi67676767
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Palace Station since 1997. I have seen alot of changes, but one thing that has not change is the service of the amazing hotel/casino/bingo staff. I have recommended this hotel to many people and will continue to do so! I think the feeling of being safe is also important.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not amazing”
Reviews.Author: greengirl_vic
Reviews.Content: Our room was close to the vending and ice machines, which made for all night noise. The walls were suprisingly thin, so I had to use ear plugs. After all the costs are added up ($15/day hotel tax) it's the same price to stay on the strip, which is what I'll be doing next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised......”
Reviews.Author: rutroh55
Reviews.Content: Our check in was quick and painless. The clerk offered us info on the players cards and the drawings they were having every night. She was very friendly. Our room was on the 12th floor overlooking Trump towers. Upon hearing all the negative reviews on bed bugs in different hotels we checked first thing upon arriving. All clear. My wife did find a few black hairs on the bed but probably from the cleaning lady, oh well. The TV was nice and the bathroom was clean and big. We ate numerous times at the Grand Cafe and the prices were 1/2 of what you pay on the strip. Cabos was good also even though when checking out I found they had charged our our meal there to our room even though I had used my debit card....we wondered how they knew what room I was in. I complained and she took it off but I will double check later. The casino was not smoky at all. We used the internet and the shuttles to the full extent since we paid for them with the $16.00 service fee. We would return and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad by any means”
Reviews.Author: auctioneerDePere
Reviews.Content: First time here and will go back. Check in was smooth and painless very friendly and helpful front desk clerk was able to get us in early. Room was 18th floor clean, with a nice comfortable bed and nice flat screen. Elevators were quick, food was excellent at the broiler, cabo the mexican was ok and the grand cafe was very good. Casino was packed and hopping Super bowl w/e the sports book was larger then expected. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Budget rooms in Older Casino”
Reviews.Author: danamite
Reviews.Content: I recently booked 3 nights online for a winter road trip and was not at all impressed with this place. After making advanced pre-paid reservations over the web, they stuck us in a downstairs guest room that faced the loading dock --- so we heard noise all night long. Recycling beer bottles and cans, lots of deliveries w/ big trucks, at all hours of the day and night. The bathrooms were great and the rooms were clean, but the constant noise was the worst ever. For our $17/night resort fee (additional fees like this are common in Vegas) - we got full use of a jacuzzi tub and the hotels shuttle to the Strip. The main walking corridor between the parking garage and the courtyard rooms was very busy, with steam cleaners at night, and crowds passing thru - and filled with slots machines, but they did have a Starbucks. Casino could get away with less slots in this busy area, so more foot traffic could pass easier with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Good, basic value hotel. Casino has lost its vibe.”
Reviews.Author: Barisarius
Reviews.Content: I was with a group spending a weekend golfing and relaxing. We decided to look for a value hotel and ended up at the Palace Station. This hotel/casino is not quite on the strip. In fact, you need a car, taxi or shuttle to get there. Fortunately, the $14.95 per night convenience fee covers the shuttle (as well as a few other nice to haves), so don't bother with a rental car if you can. On arrival, it was obvious that this place had been there for a while. Exterior features were dated and were in need of an uplift. The reception area was clean and welcoming. The desk staff was polite and helpful. As is typical in Las Vegas, smoking is allowed in the building. I'm not sure what they are doing at the Palace Station, but the ventilation must be one of the only things upgraded as you really could not smell that disgusting/lingering burnt tobacco smell. The rooms in the tower are considered an upgrade. Not sure what the other rooms look like, but other reviewers have made comments. My room had a king bed, decent furnishings and decor and a very large flat screen TV. I thought the TV was overkill since the idea of going to Las Vegas was not to stay in the room and watch the limited channel selection. In fact, for the $14,95 daily convenience fee, I would expect a lot more channel choices, including free premium cable movies. Restaurant food was just slightly above average. The only consolation was the Starbucks. Overall, a decent low budget experience with few frills. If it's adventure you seek, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay I've ever had in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: awomansopinion
Reviews.Content: We've stayed all over Vegas and staying at Palace Station was so much more relaxing. Stayed in a Courtyard room so we could park right by the door, the pool was across from the room and the casino had a convenient entrance right down the hall. Hello, how often does that happen - like never. Saved so much time that usually is spent catching elevators and walking blocks to get to the gambling. When we stayed at the Venetion last trip, we had to walk all the way to McDonalds by Flamingo to get a decent and affordable cup of coffee each morning. At Palace, delicious coffee was right inside the casino entrance at Subway or Grand Cafe. The buffet was great, the beds so comfortable and the casino was the only place we won. The casino was also very organized and easy to find the games you wanted. We'd been to Palace Station years ago and it seems they've maybe done a makeover so check it out! The only suggestion I have is the resort fee of $16.79 could be a little lower so that the room rate you're paying is closer to what you thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Haven't you heard of a resort fee?”
Reviews.Author: socal4na
Reviews.Content: Wow, I am really suprised by the number of people on here that dont know what a resort fee is. Expedia clearly states the charge and nearly every place I have stayed has one. People may as well get used to them as the number of hotels that charge it is only increasing. Remember people, read the fine print. Do you really expect a clean, safe, quiet room in a great location for $11? This place is very adequate for the price (room and resort fee). Generally, you get what you pay for. The Wynn is accross the freeway if you are looking for 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: aaronmh
Reviews.Content: We flew in for New Year's Eve and couldn't get into the timeshare until the next day so we stayed here. I thought the room smelled bad - wet, vomit, something offensive... No on else smelled it. We paid $260 for one night and then they offered us the same room for $24.00/night for the rest of the week. I thought it was worth $24, not $260. I'm glad we didn't choose to stay here, either way. To be fair, it might have just been the room we were assigned. Another room may have made a difference. Except for the smell, everything was fine. The front desk staff was very friendly - Jun checked us in. I had the $3.99 breakfast skillet in the cafe at 4:00 am which was good enough for me to go have it again at 10:00 am when I got back up.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: Honestreview7
Reviews.Content: I must say staying at The Palace Station Hotel and Casino wasGREAT! We came fromTampa FL. On Our vacation to vegas booked it on expedia.com for an amazing price.. air fare included..well arrived at the air port close to midnight and there was shouttle service ready to pick us up++got to the hotel to find out they put us almost on the top floor of the tower WOW!! What a room Spacious, Big Flat Screen T.V wich we didnt even watch becouse we didnt go to watch t.v but it was nice to have, Jaquzzi tub, big shower we could fit like 4 in it, nice cumffy king bed, bar, lounge couch huge window we could see the strip from there with great curtins, just an awsome place.I could go on but il stop here. me and my wife LOVE this place next time we go to vegas better belive we are staying here.. P.S they have an amazing buffet pay once eat all day.. Breakfast ,lunch and diner.

Reviews.Title: “I love the rooms here!”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra M
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Vegas and used to hang out at Palace Station all the time, but now when I go back I like to stay here because the rooms in the tower are fantastic! Flat screens, updated furniture, the most comfy beds ever (perfect for passing out in after a long night on the strip), complementary shuttle service from the hotel to the Fashion Show Mall on the strip, right across from They Wynn and Treasure Island, if the shuttle is too full when you're ready to hit the strip it only costs about 10-15$ to get a cab to drop you off mid strip. When I stayed for 2 night in May the cost was a little under 250.00. (the bed alone was worth the money)

Reviews.Title: “Never, ever stay here...”
Reviews.Author: gman1234
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. While checking in, the receptionist was in the process of assigning my room and made the comment- under her breath- that she thought she had just assigned the same room to the guest before me. I didn't think nothing of it... so I get my room key and walk in to my "assigned" room. Literally, less than a minute later, I hear someone trying to open my room door, so I walk over to the door to see who it was. It was the guest that was ahead of me in line. I couldn't believe the receptionist made such a basic mistake. I stay at a lot of hotels and I never write reviews. But I had to say something after this experience. Small, cramped, ugly, very basic rooms. Horrible service. Very noisy, thin walls, you hear everyone out in the hallway, no chance at a good night's sleep. All I needed was a 1 night layover, and found this cheap "deal" online, so went for it. I guess you get what you pay for - except this place is not even worth the money you save. Will never stay here again. Don't ever stay here.

Reviews.Title: “There are hidden fees and more...”
Reviews.Author: NataliaMukomel
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent 3 nights at Palace station and everything was OK until last night. We put DD sign and left the room (around noon) and after came back we found our room cleaned and DD sign was missing. Next morning we checked out and was told to pay some extra fees (16.99 per night). Total amount of fees was more than we paid actually for 3 nights staying. We were explained this is accidental fees, but when I was booking this hotel on vegas.com I didn't find anything about this. After all we are missing our personal towel from our room and they cannot find it. This happened probably when stuff cleaned this room - the towel was hanging on the chair and they just grabbed it with something else.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station proved a good value for a good quality room”
Reviews.Author: tcook052
Reviews.Content: I had booked a short one night air & hotel stay through Expedia and chose this hotel as I felt it was the better value than others at a similiar price and after my stay was glad I opted for this hotel as I feel it's a bargain even by Vegas standards. I had done some research and knew when the hotel shuttle was leaving from the airport and luckily my flight was on time and went to the hotel shuttle area and it was there waiting for me and the driver was very friendly & pleasant. Upon check in I asked about upgrading to a tower room from my Courtyard room, which I gathered were on the lower level and fairly basic almost motel rooms. The upgrade was $20 and so paid it and the resort fee and was given room 18025 which offered a nice view of Stratosphere and downtown Vegas. I was a little surprised with the large flat screen TV, large bathroom with marble counter top and big, deep tub and it was more well appointed and upscale than some rooms I've paid lots more for so felt the room was more met my needs. I asked at check out the next day and there were some renovations done to the tower rooms a year or two ago and the clerk said they gots lots of thumbs up from guests so told her to add mine to the list as I was very plesantly surprised as had been expecting a bare bones room with a cheezy western decor from 1982 and worn out highway motel sort of feel but it was anything but that. Despite the location a little way off the Strip there is a fairly regular hotel shuttle and I used it to catch a ride to the Fashion Show Mall and caught a taxi back from the far end of the Strip near Luxor and it was approx $12 one way so not a huge cost. You could walk to the Strip as Circus Circus isn't that far away but it could be not as easily done in hot weather months. I never bother renting a car in Vegas and usually just walk or take the occasional cab when necessary. Overall a very positive review of Palace Station and would easily recommend the tower rooms for someone wanting to save some dollars over staying at one of the big name Strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not great, not bad.”
Reviews.Author: usatraveler536
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here. The staff was very accommodating and nice and it's a very short drive to the strip. The room was very clean, but not very comfy. the beds were small and stiff, my wife and I slept in separate beds because they were "full" at best. The tube televisions was fuzzy with a limited number of channels. there was a lot of annoying noise from the people upstairs "enjoying each others company" on their squeaky bed. The dumpsters were also directly outside our room, making a lot of noise throughout the night. Not a bad place for cheap, but next time I'll pay a little more for a nicer place. Keep in mind there is a "convenience fee" that is additional to your booking price, but that's the norm in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never book this hotel on internet because they have hidden charge when you arrive hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark009877
Reviews.Content: I have booked the hotel(Palace Station Hotel and Casino 2411 W Sahara, Las Vegas, NV 89102) from Hotwire.com and paid by credit card. When I left hotel, and check my credit card , found there are hidden charge from this hotel(This is the first time i have run into) I have paid to the room and tax by credit card, but when you leave, they will charge you so call room service fee with $15 , they explained that it includes internet access fee, shuttle bus fee , even you never use this service. I have been to Las Vegas every year and book hotel on line always, this is first time i ran into this hidden charge in Las Vegas, suggest not book this hotel online.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the $$ not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: tweeter826919
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in august its a really nice hotel rooms are clean, updated, beds are comfortable. The casino downstairs is small but I fun. Its off the strip and I think they charged me a "resort fee" but that may have been cause I booked an online package deal. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly a $27 room, but glad we upgraded to the tower...”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryHappyFamily
Reviews.Content: We originally booked the $27 Courtyard room, but on arrival, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to the tower. After reading some of the other reviews, we're glad we did! It was an extra $20/night, but the room was great! There was also an extra $15 "Hotel Amenity Fee" added on, bringing the cost of our "$27 Hotel room" to around $80 with tax. The room was spacious, had 2 Queen beds (which were very comfortable), and had a great view of the Strip! The bathroom was large, and had beautiful tile work throughout. We were on the 10th floor, so there was no traffic noise at all from the nearby Interstate. Our room rate included the breakfast buffet, which was hit and miss. The fresh omelets and ice cream were wonderful. The "fresh" fruit and "orange" juice were not. However, the food selection made up for the drawbacks, and it was infinitely better than the continental breakfasts we'd become accustomed to. There is a choice between valet and non valet parking, but we got the sense that the valets really wanted to park our car. The bellboys also were very attentive, and were quite keen on carrying our large stack of luggage up to our room. Not that we wanted to deprive them of their income, but given that we had originally chosen the Palace Station as a "cheap" alternative (see $27 room comment above), we decided we'd rather not pay an extra $30 in tips. We asked if we could use a luggage cart to move our luggage, but were told that luggage carts "were not for guest use". I guess that's why suitcases have wheels... We can't comment on the casino or other entertainment options, as we simply stayed the night and then moved on. On the whole, despite the cost being significantly higher than originally advertised, we were quite happy with our stay at the Palace Station.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: ohiograndma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Palace Station while in Vegas, I got a quoate of $27 a nite when I checked in I was told there was an extra charge of $15 a nite plus tax. What a rip, the room was warn badly, dirty carpets, and a shower that was so small it couldn't get any smaller, and leaked water all over the floor. The resturant food was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad For the price..watch that extra fee!!”
Reviews.Author: slipshaft
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at the Palace Station (Courtyard-economy) section. The room was fairly clean and updated, the pool/hot tub area was quite nice and there is a small gym for working out. The initial price (paid online through TSP travel desk) was about $195. Then there is an extra fee for wi-fi and pool, etc after you check out which came to about an extra $105, so my average price per night including the weekend was about $50. The bathroom was rather spartan, with just a shower stall and small sink, but was updated and very clean. They gave me a King Bed which I had requested, and the parking was quite close to the room on the ground floor, which I really appreciated with a back injury and could not walk far. I usually stay at the Stratosphere which requires a long walk through the casino and a long elevator ride. Everything at Palace Station was right at my fingertips. The courtyard rooms are located near I-15 so if you are a light sleeper the freeway noise may be a problem. I've seen complaints online about bedbugs but I had no such problem. All and all I was quite satisfied with my accomodations there.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vegas value”
Reviews.Author: GaGent
Reviews.Content: The Station Casino's entry to the "strip" is a great value. My Courtyard room, although somewhat smaller than your normal room, is quite adaquate-it would depend on how much time you spend in the room. A Tower room would provide more space if you needed it. The grounds are spcious and the tables are nicely layout.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Rooms are Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TONEYTUNE
Reviews.Content: If there is a preference, take a tower room over the courtyard. The rooms are a little older in the courtyard. No frills hotel, they have two sets of towels in the room. The safe does work, and the TV is 42" plasma, but no HD. The internet in the room is complimentary, but there is a caveat to the "free" service. In small print, you will be charged a "resort" fee of $14.99 plus tax per day for services such as the free airport shuttle, newspaper in the tower rooms, internet (wired), health club, pool, etc. I think that the fees are stupid, but a lot of these hotels are struggling to make a buck. The service was adequate and the guest services agents are all professional and personable. Housekeepers kept a very clean room. It was very much appreciated. Wake up call was on-time. There is easy access to the freeway. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “TRY this hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dread2656
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Las Vegas during september for 13 nights and chose Palace Station to stay for a second time. This hotel is good value for money , with good rooms(tower) and very good service. AIRPORT : Palace Station run a good shuttle bus service from the airport to the hotel and return when you need it. timetable available from hotel web site RECEPTION. Speedy check in with a cheery receptionist who also answered any questions i had a above average check in. ROOM. We had a 5th floor room, no smoking, it was clean and smelt fresh. 2 queen size bed very comfortable with good pillows. bathroom has bath , shower, sink and toilet, it has a hairdryer and good shampoo, soap and moisteriser . 42 inch T.V. , free safe, clock radio, iron / board and 2 chairs with a table. CASINO join the reward card system at the reward centre,this will give you money off meals and points collected can be exchanged for slot play or comp dollars. Casino has a good range of machines and some good tables . while your playing you can have drinks bought to you for free(please tip the girls) there is a poker room and bingo every 2hrs from 9am to 11pm. Casino host Leisa Wells speak to her she is a first class host she can help with an array of things FOOD buffet is great for breakfast and does have a selection for lunch and dinner. chinese good food try the lunch time special open to 3am broiler good food a little more expensive coco's open 24hrs good choice of menu we enjoyed.it. sea food bar subway mexican very good POOLS 2 pools one is warmer than the other, plenty of sun beds and shady areas. both pools clean and well tended, with free pool towels. Around the hotel within a short walk there is a supermarket , 7 / 11 and a macdonalds. also a car hire depot. the shuttle can take you to the fashion mall for shopping or you walk on to the strip

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Maz Lester
Reviews.Content: I was a bit wary having read previous reviews about the hotel. However i was pleasantly surprised. Check in - There were 17 of us and it was quick and painless and they were very obliging even changing the rooms so we were all in the same area. Rooms - We all had courtyard rooms and found them to be clean and functional. All had a hairdryer a TV, WiFi, toiletries. Rooms were cleaned every day and towels changed if required. We were on the outside of the hotel next to the freeway but noise was minimal. Our room was probably located furthest from the lobby but we could park our van almost outside the room so we had no problem. Even if we didn't use the van it's not THAT much of a walk to the lobby as highlighted by some reviews. Swimming Pools - There are 2 pools the difference being is that one is heated and the other is not. However it was in the 100's when we visited so the colder pool was a welcome relief. they were never too full and if anything were under used. Towels are provided at the pool. Eateries - We used most of the restaurants and found them cheap and plentiful, the staff were always pleasant. If you are going to use the buffet make sure you get rewards card as you get it cheaper. The buffet sometimes gets very busy so you have to time it right. Also make time to eat there as there is soooo much food to choose from. Fitness Centre - the gym is small and there was a few pieces of equipment broken but it wasn't never too crowded that you couldn't get in there. Please Palace fix your machines!!! Transport - Palace provide a bus to take you to the strip/airport. The drivers are very accommodating (he dropped us off at every Terminal when returning to the airport), they are very knowledgeable and cheery! The only down point is the smoke in the casino but seeing as we didn't go to gamble it was only a minor point. I would definitely recommend to anyone who was using it a base to travel around the area eg Red Rock, Lake Mead as it's almost on the freeway!

Reviews.Title: “Reserved a room in the courtyard. One of...”
Reviews.Author: SSGJohn
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room in the courtyard. One of the super cheap ones. What they don't tell you is when you get there you get charged an additional "room maintenance fee" of 14.99 plus tax that is mandatory and is for ammenities that come standard for free anywhere else like wifi, pool, fitness center, etc... Took security 90 minutes to breakup an underage drinking party by the pool outside of our room when the security office was no more than 50 feet from the pool. Walls are paper thin and could literally hear conversations in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip hotel with mediocre casino”
Reviews.Author: SactoGamer
Reviews.Content: Compared to the newer off-strip hotel/casinos in Las Vegas, the Palace Station comes off as lacking with it's smallish casino and lack of "cool" restaurants or nightclubs, but the hotel has nice, clean rooms for a great price -- especially since the hotel is only a few blocks away from the Strip. For the low-low price of $37 per night (plus tax and all that stuff) for a tower room, the Palace Station is an absolute steal. Comfy beds, adequate rooms, clean bathrooms -- all of that is included for what is seemingly pocket change for a hotel room in any city. Check-in was a little slow as it took almost fifteen minutes to make my way through the line at the front desk, but once I got to the counter things went rather smoothly. The casino floor, while clean enough, wasn't anything spectacular. It felt a bit aged and definatly catered to a crowed older than a 20-something professional. The eateries were nothing to really write home about and the only in-hotel location that stood out (the Irish-style pub) was closed by the time I went down to check it out at around 1am. Luckily, one of the small in-casino bars was still open and sold cheap but good drinks that myself and a few local friends I had were able to enjoy while chatting about nothing in particular. If you're looking for a good, clean, affordable place to stay in Vegas but don't mind playing elsewhere then Palace Station is very hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but would stay on strip next time”
Reviews.Author: dancedance72
Reviews.Content: hotel has two parts the courtyard and the tower rooms. DEFINATELY book the tower rooms they are much better!! our tower room was huge with a great view over the strip, very comfortable beds and good size bathroom, hotel room was very clean . the hotel/casino is ok . parts of the casino smell weird (cigarette smoke/dog/vomit??!!) the hotel has several restaurants etc inside. we used only starbucks and subway and went one morning to the breakfast buffet which was great! huge selection of foods and good price. the hotel runs shuttles to the strip but not really regularly enough and certainly not running late enough. we ended up paying for cabs to strip and back and would have saved more money staying in one of the hotels on the strip itself. the room prices were good though and staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great Tower Room”
Reviews.Author: stuart316
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas - I've stayed here seven times now, and twice in the space of a month recently. The tower rooms at Palace Station are great value for money - I paid $24.99 per night plus taxes & charges for a good sized room with two queen beds, a 42" TV and a great view of the Strip. I've stayed in Courtyard rooms before and I'd always pay the few extra dollars now to stay in a Tower room. Whilst it doesn't have the glitz and glamour of some of the Strip casinos, the Palace Station is a nice quiet homely place where you're always made to feel welcome. The table gaming is good and not usually too crowded at off times which means you can have a serious gamble away from people who don't fully understand some of the protocols of table gaming (ie when to take or not take cards when playing Blackjack...I think the dealers also appreciate the serious players too). The breakfast buffet is good value (there was a weekday morning special available for $4.99 when you checked in on my recent visits), but for dinner, I'd recommend you try other restaurants within the Palace Station or buffets in some of the Strip casinos or larger "off strip" Casinos, as the selections are pretty basic and lack a bit of flair. Try the Red Rock (part of the Station group) or M casinos for better dinner buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, A Fun and Romantic Pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: VernSouthern
Reviews.Content: This place is great place for a romantic getaway. I had a work assignment in Nevada for three month and my wife was in Colorado. Half way through she flew out to Las Vegas and we had the greatest time at the Palace Station. The room had a large and very comfortable bed, a large TV, lot's of drawers and hangers in the closet that actually can off the rod so we could hang our clothe with ease. I was most impressed with the black marble walk-in shower (not bathtub) and lot's of hot water. Food - Lot's of great restaurants in the hotel. The Cabo had great Mexican food, The Broiler was a bit pricey but the service was four star and I had the best t-bone steak ever cooked, The Express Chinese would not service us, I'm not sure why. The Feast (the hotel buffet) was very good. Being a web designer and a IT guy I'm kinda a geek o I am just a nickel player on the video gaming but I had a great time in the casino. Most places keep the nickel players of in some dark corner but I found it easy to play almost anywhere in the casino. Buy the way, I hit three royal flushes during my stay and had a great time. Do yourself a favor and stay here, you won't regret it...

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for which isn't much!”
Reviews.Author: Bucnshell
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Las Vegas with your family as I did. My wife and 4 children ranging from 3 teens and a four-year old. My son played in a basketball tourney and this hotel/casino was very close to swoop nationals, so we stayed there. The courtyard rooms are pretty clean, but expect to get lost, everyone who gives you instructions will be wrong, and the guys who shuttles you to the malls and strip for "free" costs you 15 dollars per night and if you don't tip them a dollar everytime you ride, then they become rude (one guy slammed the door in my face and said Thanks for the tip sir!) If you do have a problem (and you will have many) then I suggest you go speak with the evening manager, he was actually helpful. The food is expensive but for the most part it was good. I will not be going back to the palace station. I did hear the tower rooms were much nicer, but the hired help is the same.

Reviews.Title: “Only book Tower Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nk15
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed at Palace Station we chose a courtyard room. DO NOT BOOK a courtyard room at all cost.They are just like a Motel 6 and it has NO elevator, and it is VERY easy to get lost. After signing up for their players card and getting comps we tried the tower (which we use now) the room is newly remodeled and modern almost like a strip hotel.Most of the staff were great and the Pasta Palace is excellent. The hotel has a large casino with lots of restaurants and has internet with a flat screen TV (only tower rooms). Everything is nearby and the hotel is always busy.The bathroom is large with a good shower and sink. There is a desk and nice view. AVOID the arcade most of the machines are broken and they don't fix them,and they eat your money. Palace Station is a great off strip hotel and it's a quarter mile away from it. Stay here but ONLY BOOK TOWER ROOMS OR YOU WILL REGRET IT.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, this is a Hell Station”
Reviews.Author: DingDongChicago
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via United which cost the same millage as a night in Hilton in Las Vegas. First they put us in a lodge behind the tower (Note that the only picture we saw when we made reservation was the tower). The room is small, old, and the sink drain worked partially. We called the front desk for a question which got routed to other hotels. We were on the phone for 5 minutes but nobody answered. After spending a terrible night, we checked out in the early morning and was told to pay $16 service fee for virtually no service.

Reviews.Title: “Palace Station Sickness”
Reviews.Author: Lucky5623
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palace Station over Memorial Day weekend for 4 nights last year.We got a petite suite which was nice. On Memorial day we both woke up sick and spent the day in the emergency room and were sick for the next month!They had the air conditioning down to 50 degrees there. Slots were pretty good.I liked the Italian restaurant.All I had at the buffet was soup and jello because of my sickness but buffet didn't offer much else besides tired food and poor variety.The Oyster Bar was great! We won't be going back to Palace Station even though I received a offer for 2 free nights comp in Courtyard room and $30 dining credit. We don't want to get sick and miserable again!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doeymeister
Reviews.Content: Due to all the bad reviews of the courtyard rooms, I booked in the tower, and the room was very nice, large, and as quiet as one could reasonably expect in a casino hotel. I visited the pool several times and found it relatively uncrowded with enough shade and sunny areas to satisfy everyone. It was a bit small, but large enough to apparently handle the number of guests since it was never crowded. To reach the pool, you have to walk through the courtyard facility. It is NOT nearly as long a walk as some reviewers have made it out to be. Some of the rooms are actually quicker to reach than the tower rooms. To reach it, you only have to walk through the front fringe of the casino and the exterior walk from the main building is only about 30 feet. Reading some reviews led me to expect a long walk through a desolute back lot, which was not the case. You're basically crossing what looks like a maintenance drive between the main hotel and the courtyard. All rooms open to interior halls, which basically circle the pool areas. I looked in several rooms which were open for maid service as I passed, and, while not as nice or large as the tower rooms, they did not look any worse than a Holiday Inn. I can't vouch for their cleanliness, but there were no obvious signs like bad smells or trash sitting around to imply that they were not maintained just as well as the tower. In fact, since they're all smoke-free, the hall smelled better than the tower. I would not hesitate to grab the low rate on a courtyard room in the future. Buffet was mediocre at best, both breakfast and dinner (and I'm not usually picky). On site restaurants have some reasonable prices and specials though, so you're not locked in to eating at the buffet every meal. Check-in/check-out was a breeze with no line on check-in and express checkout over your TV. If you plan on eating breakfast in the buffet during your stay, take advantage of the special rate at check-in to save a buck over even the reduced Player's Club rate. Do get a free Player's Club card though, even if you don't intend to gamble enough to earn any comps, because you will save money on the buffet by flashing it. And, high speed internet is free for the lower speed, which is on par with the speed of a DSL line. Free shuttle to airport and strip, but it only runs about every hour and a half. Check their schedule on-line by searching for "Palace Station Shuttle Schedule".

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in tower rooom”
Reviews.Author: BleednBlu
Reviews.Content: We'd never been to this hotel and were happy with it. The room was good size, bathroom was very nice size. The room was clean and very nice. The price was nice too. I think its a good deal and is better than the other hotels in Vegas in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT??!! window to the hallway w/ pix”
Reviews.Author: DARquest
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Palace Station for one night in a Courtyard room... OK - so not expecting much.... But - the room was the basic two queen, stand up shower, and my small window was open to a closed off veranda that I could not access and facing the hallway which I just walked through to get to the room. Checking-in was very friendly. Courtyard rooms are outside of the main casino / hotel. Wireless Internet was in room, however, spotty, it would disconnect my connection from time to time. No extra cable channels. Across the street from Landry's Seafood Restaurant, went there had a nice meal at bar. Not really walking distance to anything... I walked to CVS, but it was quite a ways down the road, not many are willing to walk that far. Shuttle to mall, very good and on time. Dropped off at mall and then went about my way.

Reviews.Title: “Tower Room was great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nancy_Stahl
Reviews.Content: My fiance/husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel and had a tower room. It was perfectly ok for our stay. We did see the courtyard rooms when we were looking for the pool(s) and they do look like motel rooms. We would stay in the tower rooms again, but would not be interested in the courtyard ones. As for the casino, I won approximatly $130 on the Monopoly 1 cent machines, but didn't really play any of the others. My now husband also won about $40 on a similar machine. The casino was smokier than others in the nicer casinos we visited on the strip. We only ate at the Feast Buffet and the service was great and the food was ok. I expected a bit more for a Vegas buffet, but we ate at it twice and it was filling enough. The room was clean and I would have probably given that area a "5", but there was a dirty drink glass that was left on the bathroom vanity that housekeeping did not notice/remove. The trash was emptied and fresh linens were provided each day of our stay. We would have no problem staying here again, as the "issues" were small and not anything to really stress over.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel to say the least”
Reviews.Author: doris1945
Reviews.Content: My husband and I received an offer for a comp'd room in the Palace Station Courtyard. Free is NOT a good price for this roach motel. As we entered the door to the hallway of the Courtyard my husband smelled old insect spray. I thought that means they attempted to control pests. They might have attempted, but they lost the battle. The room was vintage 1960's motel style with a hideous "run down" appearance and a bathroom with dirt in the corners of the room and disintegrating tile with big openings around the base of the shower stall. Needless to say this all made a highway "in" for the roaches we soon encountered. Don't waste your time nor money on the Palace Station Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Book a tower Room”
Reviews.Author: rtfulk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Palace for 7 nights and when we went to check in the lady informed us there were no non smoking rooms and they did not take requests concerning smoking preferences. When I threatened to leave and asked for refund and then asked to see hotel manager they mysterically was able to locate 2 non smoking tower rooms. Whatever you do BOOK THE TOWER ROOM. The room was nice and clean and beds were comfty. Maids did a great job keeping room clean. We had a huge shower only no tub in our room and great shower head and all tower rooms have flat screen tvs . There are a variety of restaurants including a subway for a quick lunch. The Broiler Room was excellent had steak lobster special for $25 with wonderful fresh salad bar. We went to play bingo and the agents are friendly. I found the slots to be rather tight. The pool area was nice with a large jacuzzi and lots of pool towels available. It is located by the courtyard rooms. They are remodeling those rooms but I would still suggest booking a tower room. After we got the problem settled about the non smoking room, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone who does not like the hustle and bustle of the strip although they offer free shuttle to the strip whenever you want to go. Yes there is an extra charge of 14.99 per day which includes the internet and the shuttle and daily newspaper. I wish they would just up the room rate and include these fees.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST HOTEL EVER!!! Random Strangers walked into my room at 3am!!”
Reviews.Author: mghboston
Reviews.Content: I would STRONGLY suggest avoiding this HOTEL...at ALL COST!!! Its definitely the WORST hotel Ive stayed at !!!! At 3 am on the 1st night my room was invade by a random couple who had been given exactly the same room as mine!!! The next morning I found out that they had canceled my room in the middle of night and given it to another couple by ACCIDENT!! Ive never had my room being invaded by random strangers in the middle of the NIGHT!! There is always a first for everything!! As if having your room invaded wasn't enough, next morning cleaning lady walked into the room at 7.30am!!! Forget about sleeping in Las Vegas... Next time I think might be safer to be out all night on the Las Vegas Strip than staying in a hotel ROOM!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: sallyjb88
Reviews.Content: The first two nights were spent in the Courtyard, where this part of the hotel definitely needs a renovation. The hallway carpet is worn, walls need painting, and there is a very unpleasant odor in the hallway leading to the room. The bed was not very comfortable, the furniture fairly worn. Conversations in adjacent rooms can easily be heard, as the walls are paper thin. If you're used to an HD LCD or plasma TV, these rooms only have regular television sets. The last two nights were spent in the Tower on the 8th floor. These are very nice quiet rooms. The furniture is new and tasteful with a nice desk and internet connection. There is a large dresser to put your clothes and a nice-size closet, as well as a 50" HD LCD TV, large bathroom with lots of granite counter space, pleasantly-set central air conditioning, sunny with nice window view of city, but again bed comfort was fair and I did miss a coffee pot. The hotel has a very nice large casino (smoking) and bingo hall. In my opinion, the bingo buy-ins are too high and the pay-outs too low. The slots were tight and seemed just to tease. I did not see one person win any significant amount of money the whole time I was there. Although the floor waitress did come around quite often bringing drinks which kept me very happy! We had dinner at Coco's. I ordered baby back ribs that were tough, not tender, probably reheated. I did not say anything, as it was the "special" and most of the time you get what you pay for. However, the mashed potatoes were delicious! No splurging on the butter! The Buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner has a fairly good selection, but food is definitely not top quality; ok if average is what you're expecting. Price is not bad. Overall, the stay at this hotel was very enjoyable. Staff was very polite and helpful. I would definitely recommend booking a room in the Tower, unless by the time you read this review, you’ve found out the Courtyard rooms have gotten an upgrade or if the Courtyard rate is substantially less than the Tower rooms. Also, if you fly in and don't have a rental car, the hotel has a free shuttle service that runs about every 1-1/2 hrs to and from the airport. The free shuttle also runs about every hour from the hotel to the Strip and back too, which is nice since hotel is not located on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “As advertised”
Reviews.Author: godfather18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week, and since I was uninterested in the vivacity of the Strip, I was keen to stay at a nice place off the strip. Upon arrival, I was pleased to see a spacious, bright lobby. We upgraded to a premium tower room, and a savvy traveler is well aware of the $17.00 fee that they charge, we knew about it before we arrived. We went to our room to drop off our bags. The elevators were clean and well maintained. The hallway to our room was bright and smelled very clean. Our room was well stocked and very nice, with two queen sized beds, a beautiful newly renovated bathroom (with AMAZING toiletries, I stole as many as I could get away with lol!), clean carpet, white bedsheets. A large screen tv with lots of good channels turned out to be a saving grace, as the weather was so cold and windy when we were there that we spent a bit more time than we normally would have in our room. It was quiet, but we had some noisy neighbors one or two nights (my hubby would disagree, of course he didn't hear a thing lol!!) The casino was typical of what you would expect, but if you enjoy the mayhem of a Harrahs/Excalibur/MGM type casino, you may not enjoy the Palace Station casino as it's much more laid back than any casino on the Strip. The buffet was a good deal price-wise, and had many selections, but it became a little repetitive. They could switch up the menu items more. Cabos Mexican restaurant was great - authentic and great service. We didn't try the Oyster Bar, but it was always packed so they must have been doing something right. The broiler resaurant was comfortable, we went there on our first night and it was tasty, well priced food - nothing spectacular. The Italian restaurant was TERRIBLE - avoid it unless you like way overpriced Chef-Boy-R-Dee. We went to a comedy night and it was great! I forget the comedian's name but he was on Last Comic Standing and he was so funny! The shuttle service to/from the Strip was timely, but I'd like to see more availability. That's all I can think of, I would highly recommend it if you're not into the chaos of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF ADDITIONAL $17 "resort fee" per night!”
Reviews.Author: mcgnatasha
Reviews.Content: You think you are getting a good deal until you arrive and they tack on an additional $17 PER NIGHT without telling you until check out. GROSS HOTEL BY THE FREEWAY. It hasn't been remodled since the 70's. There isn't even a bathtub in the room. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “horrible rooms and not so good customer service”
Reviews.Author: minnesotawinter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at palace station about 5 days ago for 3 nights. All the bad reviews are correct!!!! We had the first room which had a sign in it that said a $250 cleaning charge for this room if you smoke in it. But it already smelled horrible. We could not take the smell in the room any longer than the first night! The hallway smelled bad too. We asked the front desk for a different room. They tried to up sell us for another $50 dollars a night for a room in the tower. We said no and then there was another room available for us in the other part of the hotel. We packed our bags and went to the new room. That room did not smell, but the shower head was so low that my wife of 5 feet 5 could not stand under the rainfall shower head without touching her head it. The shower curtain was too small for the already tiny shower and was impossible not to get the floor soaked!!!! The rooms look nice and the bathrooms look nice with the tile on the walls, but looks looks is not good enough when the smell starts to burn your nose. There are no coffee makers or fridges in the rooms. The first room had a high speed internet cord on the table, but the second room had the box for the high speed cable but no cable in the box!! The food at the casino is not good and is not cheap. I ordered a bottle of beer at one of the casino bars and was charged $3.50. That is more than what any bar in our home area charges. I thought the casino was suppose to be cheaper. The entire casino has a very very strong smoke smell from all the smokers. We went to some other casinos that are on the strip and not one of them had even a hint of smoke smell!!! Then at check out they tried to double charge us!!! We already paid with the travel agent. The double charges are still on the credit card, but the card said that the charges will be taken off once they recieve copies of our paperwork from the travel agent. Thank god for credit cards. The front desk staff was not overly friendly. We will never never never stay at the palace station again!!!!!!! It was not a good experience at all. Please believe all the negative reviews of this hotel, unless your spending more money for the rooms in the tower. But even if your in the more expensive rooms, you'll still have to deal with the not so good food and smokey smell in the casino!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in vegas”
Reviews.Author: katilla10
Reviews.Content: First of all they charged us around $17.00 extra fees per day, suppose for some extra features and a bus that could bring us to the strip area, well this bus closes at 12 so if you want it after that you cant, so actually you dont get anything for your 17 diary. The room smells really bad, they don't even have a tub just a small shower really tiny with a curtain no even glass door. you can barely move in that bathroom. The buffet that palace station offer is awful that food made me sick, I couldn't see anything good in this hotel, and of course i request my refund for the next days and went to a different hotel. I think is good everybody knows about the bad experience i had.

Reviews.Title: “Tower room was great, good deals to be had”
Reviews.Author: RangeviewRay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just a quick night in Vegas. Mid-week room rates very cheap on Expedia, even after adding the annoying $15/night fee -- but all of the Vegas hotels seem to be playing that game now. Non-smoking tower room was spacious, smelled and looked clean, and had a huge flat-screen TV that was great for watching the Olympics. Wireless internet worked fine. The room did not have a bathtub, just a very large shower, that was fine with us. King size bed was comfy. We did notice some noise from adjacent rooms (television, conversation, etc) so it might be a problem if you got noisy neighbors. We walked over to the Rio (10 minutes), it looked like the Strip was probably another 10 minutes, so the free shuttle (every 90 minutes) or just take the bus might be the way to do that. Would have liked a coffee maker in the room, but Starbucks was just an elevator ride away.

Reviews.Title: “off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: billy_boognish
Reviews.Content: This is a SPECTACULAR place to stay off the strip in vegas! Quick access to everything without all the hassel. Resturant is excellent for price and quality. Good casino. I thought it was the perfect BASE-CAMP. Affordable, friendly, great atmosphere! Highly recomend it to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: JanGIllinois
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Palace Station many times, often twice a year. We always stay in theTower Rooms. Our Casino Host has always gone beyond the call of duty. Dealers are friendly. The food is good and everything is reasonably priced. Is it the Wynn, the Encore, etc. no, but it is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more and get less”
Reviews.Author: CPACFE_HaciedaHts_CA
Reviews.Content: I paid $19 per night, but got charged an additional $14.99/night plus tax for a resort fee. I called both Palace Station and Hotwire about this charge. They didn't care or listen to what I had to say about this charge. The $15 disclosure at Hotwire is a very small print. Other hotels at Vegas might charge additional fees at $5-$10, but not as high as $15 at the Palace Station. Here are the things I got: (1) a room with NO coffee pot. This is the first time I ever rented a hotel/motel room without a coffee pot. (2) I had to wake up at 6:30 AM. I requested wake-up calls with a live hotel operator. 2 of 5 the mornings I received NO wake up calls (3) Before I even saw the room, I was asked (at check in) to pay additional $10 to up grade my room to the tower. (4) Prostitutes walking in and out of the building in the evening hours (2 of the10 times that I walked to my room from the Casino area).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: SamiJ3
Reviews.Content: Stay in the tower. All rooms are remodeled and have nice 3-D televisions. There are a lot of places to eat in the casino. The seafood bar is awesome. It even drags in the locals. Rooms are a bargain - but you don't usually spend a lot of time in the rooms anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: daddy07
Reviews.Content: We asked for a non smoking room got a smoking room they said thats all they had (booked 7 weeks in advance). Then the $14.99 FEE "PER NIGHT" THAT WE DID NOT USE. That fee is [-]. So we get to our room go to the bathroom there was hairs all over the toilet seat and on the floor and on our towels. Then we pull the bedding down to check the sheets and theres hairs all in our sheets. No refrigerartors no coffee makers then the housekeeper woke us up at 7:00 Am so we got up we asked for more towles. Then they came back between noon and 1 when we was out and it looked like they went through our bags wasnt how we left it. Didnt think they needed to come back after waking us up at 7:00 am..............................The boiler resturant IS WAY TO HIGH FOR WHAT IT IS. $100 bucks for the 2 of us (no alcohal) then they had extra stuff on our bill we didnt order questioned them about it oh my finger accidentally hit the wrong buttons (3 times) they took it off but still the point. our bill was $120 then they took it off it was a $100. Theres much more nicer resturants around for that price with way better food, service atmosphere. Personally if i am going to spend $100 bucks for 2 with non alcohalic drinks the people need to dress nicer people with sweats and t-shirt and shorts and a jersey on and there daughter had there pajamas on with house slippers. Dress code did not match the expensive prices.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas trip in August 2009”
Reviews.Author: BrentHoop
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Palace Station was amazing... The Tower room was spacious and the view was amazing... The restaurants in the hotel were delicious and very reasonably priced... We had an amazing time and would most definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget to add the $15/NIGHT 'fee' when you're shopping around”
Reviews.Author: RobBirmingham2
Reviews.Content: It's both slimy and cheesy, but they add a $15/night "fee" to your bill which they do disclose, albeit in the fine print. A pal in the business told me they do this so that when people sort their results by price, they appear cheaper by $15/night. It's a stupid/insulting game for them to play. The hotel is fine. For what I payed, including the "fee", I had no complaints,

Reviews.Title: “cheap and nice”
Reviews.Author: Nickynice4
Reviews.Content: cheap and nice but it isnt on the strip,they have a free shuttle every hour or its just better to buy a 24 hr tick on the deuce

Reviews.Title: “Great Time had by all!”
Reviews.Author: gemini-gal
Reviews.Content: Our Stay- Jan 23rd- Jan 30th 2010 Our Crew- me 39, hubby 44, mom 60, dad 60. Price- $435.00-per room -7 days We checked in about 11:30 pm. There was no wait, great service. We reserved 2 king premium tower rooms. We got 2 queen premium tower rooms. No big deal, it was still a nice room. Maid service was good, rooms were cleaned daily. We signed up for their rewards program to collect points. That turned out to be really beneficial. We ended up saving 100.00 off our room, and my parents basically had their room comped! They also got a free breakfast from the buffet! We ate at the buffet twice for breakfast, good food, good price. We also ate at the Pasta Palace twice and it was very good and would definately reccommend it to everyone. We also ate twice at Coco's for breakfast. Good food , service and price. We went to the bingo hall and enjoyed that quite a bit. Someone won $143 000.00 while we were there. So to let all of you know people do actually win that JUMBO. We played the slots in the casino and had some luck, but my parents had quite a bit of luck! They basically won the cost of their whole vacation! We did rent a car while we were there so I think that made a difference in us really liking the location. I do think it might be too far to walk to the strip. We really enjoyed our trip and my parents are already talking about returning.

Reviews.Title: “Average choice”
Reviews.Author: BrazilEddie
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful hotel with a large gambling saloon and about five restaurants inside. It's incredibly big. I've had to walk nearly 1 mile from the hotel lobby just to reach my courtyard room. The room was pretty clean, the beds and linen are comfortable, bathroom OK. One lampshade was not working. I loved the hot pool (they call it Spa) in the swimming pool area. The hotel offers free shuttle to/from the airport and to/from The Strip nearly all day. It's nearly one departure each hour. I think it's average just because there are many other great hotels in the vicinity for the same price and closer to The Strip. If I get back to Vegas again, I'll surely choose another hotel. If you lose a shuttle, you will need to walk 15 to 20 minutes til The Strip. The closest Strip's hotels are the Stratosphere, the Sahara and the Circus Circus. It's very far from the Fremont Street experience (nearly 3 miles). There are some hidden fees when you check-out (you can use the internet, but it's not for free).

Reviews.Title: “NASCAR weekend”
Reviews.Author: NascarfanBR72
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay just off the strip. Great rooms, great service, and great fun! Will always recommend the Palace Station in Vegas, especially for NASCAR weekend. Complete with shuttle buses to and from the track, door to door delivery, and complimentary breakfast too. Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Hostel price for hotel quality”
Reviews.Author: Spuderella
Reviews.Content: When my friend and I decided to backpack round America in a no frills kind of way, we never thought about actually staying in a HOTEL! But after overhearing someone say how some of the hostels in Vegas were dodgy (watch out for Sin City hostel apparently), and the hotels weren't much more expensive, we decided to do our research. We couldn't believe it when we came across Palace Station Hotel and Casino for about £30 per night for a double room! Unfortunately, we stayed over a weekend as well, when the prices were a bit higher-£50 per room, but still, it was a bargain. After a 10 hour greyhound trip we were amazed and confused at how nice our room was, and the hotel. We took the opportunity to include breakfast-a must do-all you can eat for an extra few dollars! The pool and jacuzzi were fantastic and even though the hotel was not right on the strip, a free shuttle bus from the hotel to the strip every couple of hours made it not at all a problem. The only thing I could negatively say would be that the casino on the ground floor was quite smoky, because, obviously, it was a casino, but in the actual accommodation, it was fine. Staff were friendly, even though they didn't know themselves they had an ice machine when I asked, and the food was briliant. The rooms were very quiet, and no noise could be heard from downstairs. If you're on a budget, but would like a bit of luxury in comparison to the hostels, this hotel is one not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Small, quiet and unassuming”
Reviews.Author: andrew1502
Reviews.Content: Palace Station is part of a chain of hotels and fits into the middle of the pack. By casino standards it's small and surprisingly quiet. You can probably book a room for around $25 if you don't mind the Courtyard rooms but it's worth spending the extra for the superior tower rooms. Beware the "Facilities" charge, added daily to your bill at the rate of $16. Haggle when you check in and you can cut this "tax" down to size. The hotel has little in the way of facilities other than the swimming pools but once I was in my tower room I didn't care. Like all hotels in Vegas, the price of everything is painfully high and there are no refrigerators or coffee facilities in the rooms but if the price is right it doesn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: msdiamonds
